summary.long: Ezekiel is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: Now it came about in the thirtieth year, on the fifth day of the fourth month, while I was by the river Chebar among the exiles, the heavens were opened and I saw visions of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (On the fifth of the month in the fifth year of King Jehoiachin’s exile,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the word of the Lord came expressly to Ezekiel the priest, son of Buzi, in the land of the Chaldeans by the river Chebar; and there the hand of the Lord came upon him.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As I looked, behold, a high wind was coming from the north, a great cloud with fire flashing intermittently and a bright light around it, and in its midst something like gleaming metal in the midst of the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And within it there were figures resembling four living beings. And this was their appearance: they had human form.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of them had four faces and four wings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their legs were straight and their feet were like a calf’s hoof, and they sparkled like polished bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Under their wings on their four sides were human hands. As for the faces and wings of the four of them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their wings touched one another; their faces did not turn when they moved, each went straight forward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the form of their faces, each had a human face; all four had the face of a lion on the right and the face of a bull on the left, and all four had the face of an eagle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Such were their faces. Their wings were spread out above; each had two touching another being, and two covering their bodies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And each went straight forward; wherever the spirit was about to go, they would go, without turning as they went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the midst of the living beings there was something that looked like burning coals of fire, like torches moving among the living beings. The fire was bright, and lightning was flashing from the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the living beings ran back and forth like bolts of lightning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as I looked at the living beings, behold, there was one wheel on the ground beside the living beings, for each of the four of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The appearance of the wheels and their workmanship was like sparkling topaz, and all four of them had the same form, their appearance and workmanship being as if one wheel were within another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever they moved, they moved in any of their four directions without turning as they moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for their rims, they were high and awesome, and the rims of all four of them were covered with eyes all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever the living beings moved, the wheels moved with them. And whenever the living beings rose from the earth, the wheels rose also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherever the spirit was about to go, they would go in that direction. And the wheels rose just as they did; for the spirit of the living beings was in the wheels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever those went, they went; and whenever those stopped, they stopped. And whenever those rose from the earth, the wheels rose just as they did; for the spirit of the living beings was in the wheels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now over the heads of the living beings there was something like an expanse, like the awesome gleam of crystal, spread out over their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Under the expanse their wings were stretched out straight, one toward the other; each one also had two wings covering its body on the one side and on the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I also heard the sound of their wings, like the sound of abundant waters as they went, like the voice of the Almighty, a sound of a crowd like the sound of an army camp; whenever they stopped, they let down their wings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And a voice came from above the expanse that was over their heads; whenever they stood still, they let down their wings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now above the expanse that was over their heads there was something resembling a throne, like lapis lazuli in appearance; and on that which resembled a throne, high up, was a figure with the appearance of a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I noticed from the appearance of His waist and upward something like gleaming metal that looked like fire all around within it, and from the appearance of His waist and downward I saw something like fire; and there was a radiance around Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Like the appearance of the rainbow in the clouds on a rainy day, so was the appearance of the surrounding radiance. Such was the appearance of the likeness of the glory of the Lord. And when I saw it, I fell on my face and heard a voice speaking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Son of man, stand on your feet, and I will speak with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as He spoke to me the Spirit entered me and set me on my feet; and I heard Him speaking to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Son of man, I am sending you to the sons of Israel, to a rebellious people who have rebelled against Me; they and their fathers have revolted against Me to this very day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I am sending you to those who are impudent and obstinate children, and you shall say to them, ‘This is what the Lord God says:’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for them, whether they listen or not—for they are a rebellious house—they will know that a prophet has been among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as for you, son of man, you are not to fear them nor fear their words, though thistles and thorns are with you and you sit on scorpions; you are not to fear their words nor be dismayed at their presence, since they are a rebellious house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you shall speak My words to them whether they listen or not, for they are rebellious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now you, son of man, listen to what I am speaking to you; do not be rebellious like that rebellious house. Open your mouth wide and eat what I am giving you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I looked, and behold, a hand was extended to me; and behold, a scroll was in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He spread it out before me, it was written on the front and back, and written on it were songs of mourning, sighing, and woe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Son of man, eat what you find; eat this scroll, and go, speak to the house of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I opened my mouth, and He fed me this scroll.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to me, “Son of man, feed your stomach and fill your body with this scroll which I am giving you.” Then I ate it, and it was as sweet as honey in my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Son of man, go to the house of Israel and speak with My words to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you are not being sent to a people of unintelligible speech or difficult language, but to the house of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor to many peoples of unintelligible speech or difficult language, whose words you cannot understand. But I have sent you to the people who understand you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: yet the house of Israel will not be willing to listen to you, since they are not willing to listen to Me. The entire house of Israel certainly is stubborn and obstinate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I have made your face just as hard as their faces, and your forehead just as hard as their foreheads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Like emery harder than flint I have made your forehead. Do not be afraid of them or be dismayed before them, since they are a rebellious house.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, He said to me, “Son of man, take into your heart all My words which I will speak to you and listen closely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go to the exiles, to the sons of your people, and speak to them and tell them, whether they listen or not, ‘This is what the Lord God says.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Spirit lifted me up, and I heard a great rumbling sound behind me: “Blessed be the glory of the Lord from His place!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I heard the sound of the wings of the living beings touching one another and the sound of the wheels beside them, even a great rumbling sound.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Spirit lifted me up and took me away; and I went embittered in the rage of my spirit, and the hand of the Lord was strong on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I came to the exiles who lived beside the river Chebar at Tel-abib, and I sat there for seven days where they were living, causing consternation among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at the end of seven days the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, I have appointed you as a watchman for the house of Israel; whenever you hear a word from My mouth, warn them from Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I say to the wicked, ‘You will certainly die,’ and you do not warn him or speak out to warn the wicked from his wicked way so that he may live, that wicked person shall die for wrongdoing, but his blood I will require from your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However if you have warned the wicked and he does not turn from his wickedness or from his wicked way, he shall die for wrongdoing, but you have saved yourself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, when a righteous person turns away from his righteousness and commits sin, and I place an obstacle before him, he will die; since you have not warned him, he shall die in his sin, and his righteous deeds which he has done shall not be remembered; but his blood I will require from your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, if you have warned the righteous person that the righteous is not to sin, and he does not sin, he shall certainly live because he took warning; and you have saved yourself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the hand of the Lord was on me there, and He said to me, “Get up, go out to the plain, and there I will speak to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I got up and went out to the plain; and behold, the glory of the Lord was standing there, like the glory that I saw by the river Chebar, and I fell on my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Spirit entered me and set me up on my feet; and He spoke with me and said to me, “Go, shut yourself inside your house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as for you, son of man, they will put ropes around you and bind you with them so that you do not go out among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, I will make your tongue stick to the roof of your mouth so that you will be unable to speak and will not be a man who reprimands them, since they are a rebellious house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when I speak to you, I will open your mouth and you will say to them, ‘This is what the Lord God says:’ The one who hears, let him hear; and the one who refuses, let him refuse; for they are a rebellious house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now you, son of man, get yourself a brick, place it before you, and inscribe a city on it—Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then lay siege against it, build a siege wall, pile up an assault ramp, set up camps, and place battering rams against it all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then get yourself an iron plate and set it up as an iron wall between yourself and the city, and direct your face toward it so that it is under siege, and besiege it. This will be a sign to the house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you are to lie down on your left side and put the wrongdoing of the house of Israel on it; you shall bear their wrongdoing for the number of days that you lie on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have assigned you a number of days corresponding to the years of their wrongdoing, 390 days; so you shall bear the wrongdoing of the house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you have completed these days, you shall lie down a second time, but on your right side, and bear the wrongdoing of the house of Judah; I have assigned it to you for forty days, a day for each year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall direct your face toward the siege of Jerusalem with your arm bared, and prophesy against it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now behold, I will put ropes around you so that you cannot turn from your one side to your other until you have completed the days of your siege.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But as for you, take wheat, barley, beans, lentils, millet, and spelt, and put them in one vessel and make them into bread for yourself; you shall eat it according to the number of the days that you lie on your side, 390 days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your food which you eat shall be twenty shekels a day by weight; you shall eat it from time to time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The water you drink shall be a sixth of a hin by measure; you shall drink it from time to time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall eat it as a barley cake, having baked it in their sight over human dung.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said, “In this way the sons of Israel will eat their bread unclean among the nations where I will scatter them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I said, “Oh, Lord God! Behold, I have never been defiled; for from my youth until now I have never eaten what died of itself or was torn by animals, nor has any unclean meat ever entered my mouth!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to me, “See, I will give you cow’s dung in place of human dung, so that you may prepare your bread over it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, He said to me, “Son of man, behold, I am going to break the staff of bread in Jerusalem, and they will eat bread by weight and with anxiety, and drink water by measure and in horror,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because bread and water will be scarce; and they will tremble with one another and waste away in their guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for you, son of man, take a sharp sword; take and use it as a barber’s razor on your head and beard. Then take scales for weighing and divide the hair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A third you shall burn in the fire at the center of the city, when the days of the siege are completed. Then you shall take a third and strike it with the sword all around the city, and a third you shall scatter to the wind; for I will unsheathe a sword behind them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take also a few hairs in number from them and bind them in the hems of your robes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take again some of them and throw them into the fire and burn them in the fire; from it a fire will spread to all the house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the Lord God says: ‘This is Jerusalem; I have placed her at the center of the nations, with lands around her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But she has rebelled against My ordinances more wickedly than the nations, and against My statutes more than the lands which surround her; for they have rejected My ordinances and have not walked in My statutes.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, this is what the Lord God says: ‘Because you have more turmoil than the nations that surround you and have not walked in My statutes, nor executed My ordinances, nor acted in accordance with the ordinances of the nations around you,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, this is what the Lord God says: ‘Behold, I, even I, am against you, and I will execute judgments among you in the sight of the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And because of all your abominations I will do among you what I have not done, and the like of which I will never do again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, fathers will eat their sons among you, and sons will eat their fathers; for I will execute judgments on you and scatter all your remnant to every wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore as I live,’ declares the Lord God, ‘Because you have defiled My sanctuary with all your detestable idols and with all your abominations, I definitely will also withdraw and My eye will have no pity, and I also will not spare.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A third of you will die by plague or perish by famine among you, a third will fall by the sword around you, and a third I will scatter to every wind, and I will unsheathe a sword behind them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Then My anger will be spent and I will satisfy My wrath on them, and I will be appeased; then they will know that I, the Lord, have spoken in My zeal, when I have spent My wrath upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, I will make you a site of ruins and a disgrace among the nations that surround you, in the sight of everyone who passes by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it will be a disgrace, an object of abuse, a warning, and an object of horror to the nations that surround you when I execute judgments against you in anger, wrath, and raging reprimands. I, the Lord, have spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I send against them the deadly arrows of famine which were for the destruction of those whom I will send to destroy you, then I will also intensify the famine upon you and break off your provision of bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will send on you famine and vicious animals, and they will bereave you of children; plague and bloodshed also will pass through you, and I will bring the sword on you. I, the Lord, have spoken.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, set your face toward the mountains of Israel, and prophesy against them
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say, ‘Mountains of Israel, listen to the word of the Lord God! This is what the Lord God says to the mountains, the hills, the ravines, and the valleys: “Behold, I Myself am going to bring a sword against you, and I will destroy your high places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So your altars will become deserted and your incense altars will be smashed; and I will make your slain fall in front of your idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will also lay the dead bodies of the sons of Israel in front of their idols; and I will scatter your bones around your altars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everywhere you live, cities will be in ruins and the high places will be deserted, so that your altars will be in ruins and deserted, your idols will be broken and brought to an end, your incense altars will be cut down, and your works wiped out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The slain will fall among you, and you will know that I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “However, I will leave a remnant, in that you will have those who escaped the sword among the nations when you are scattered among the countries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then those of you who escape will remember Me among the nations to which they will be taken captive, how I have been hurt by their adulterous hearts which turned away from Me, and by their eyes which committed infidelity with their idols; and they will loathe themselves in their own sight for the evils which they have committed, for all their abominations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will know that I am the Lord; I have not said in vain that I would inflict this disaster on them.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the Lord God says: ‘Clap your hands, stamp your foot and say, “Woe, because of all the evil abominations of the house of Israel, which will fall by the sword, famine, and plague!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who is far away will die by the plague, anyone who is near will fall by the sword, and anyone who remains and is spared from these will die by the famine. So I will expend My wrath on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will know that I am the Lord, when their dead are among their idols around their altars, on every high hill, on all the tops of the mountains, under every leafy tree and under every massive oak with thick branches—the places where they offered a soothing aroma to all their idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So through all their dwelling places I will stretch out My hand against them and make the land more desolate and waste than the wilderness toward Diblah; so they will know that I am the Lord.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you, son of man, this is what the Lord God says to the land of Israel: ‘An end! The end is coming on the four corners of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the end is upon you, for I will send My anger against you; I will judge you according to your ways and bring all your abominations upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And My eye will have no pity on you, nor will I spare you, but I will bring your ways upon you, and your abominations will be among you; then you will know that I am the Lord!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is what the Lord God says: ‘A disaster, a unique disaster, behold, it is coming!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An end is coming; the end has come! It has awakened against you; behold, it has come!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your doom has come to you, you inhabitant of the land. The time has come, the day is near—panic rather than joyful shouting on the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I will shortly pour out My wrath on you and expend My anger against you; I will judge you according to your ways and bring on you all your abominations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My eye will have no pity nor will I spare you. I will repay you according to your ways, while your abominations are in your midst; then you will know that I, the Lord, am striking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Behold, the day! Behold, it is coming! Your doom has gone forth; the rod has budded, arrogance has blossomed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Violence has grown into a rod of wickedness. None of them shall remain, none of their people, none of their wealth, nor anything eminent among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The time has come, the day has arrived. Let neither the buyer rejoice nor the seller mourn; for wrath is against all their multitude.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, the seller will not regain what he sold as long as they both live; for the vision regarding all their multitude will not be averted, nor will any of them maintain his life by his wrongdoing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘They have blown the trumpet and made everything ready, but no one is going to the battle, for My wrath is against all their multitude.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sword is outside the city and the plague and the famine are within. Anyone who is in the field will die by the sword, while famine and the plague will consume those in the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even when their survivors escape, they will be on the mountains like doves of the valleys, all of them moaning, each over his own wrongdoing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All hands will hang limp, and all knees will drip with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will put on sackcloth and shuddering will overwhelm them; and shame will be on all faces, and a bald patch on all their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will fling their silver into the streets, and their gold will become an abhorrent thing; their silver and their gold will not be able to save them on the day of the wrath of the Lord. They cannot satisfy their appetite, nor can they fill their stomachs, because their wrongdoing has become a cause of stumbling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, they transformed the splendor of His jewels into pride, and they made the images of their abominations and their detestable things with it; therefore I will make it an abhorrent thing to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will hand it over to the foreigners as plunder, and to the wicked of the earth as spoils; and they will profane it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will also turn My face away from them, and they will profane My treasure; then robbers will enter and profane it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Make the chain, for the land is full of bloody crimes, and the city is full of violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, I will bring the worst of the nations, and they will take possession of their houses. I will also put an end to the pride of the strong ones, and their holy places will be profaned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When anguish comes, they will seek peace, but there will be none.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Disaster will come upon disaster and rumor will be added to rumor; then they will seek a vision from a prophet, but the Law will be lost from the priest, and counsel from the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king will mourn, the prince will be clothed in horror, and the hands of the people of the land will tremble. I will deal with them because of their conduct, and by their judgments I will judge them. And they will know that I am the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came about in the sixth year, on the fifth day of the sixth month, as I was sitting in my house with the elders of Judah sitting before me, that the hand of the Lord God fell upon me there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I looked, and behold, something like the appearance of a man; from His waist and downward there was the appearance of fire, and from His waist and upward like the appearance of a glow, like gleaming metal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He extended the form of a hand and took me by the hair of my head; and the Spirit lifted me up between earth and heaven and brought me in the visions of God to Jerusalem, to the entrance of the north gate of the inner courtyard, where the seat of the idol of jealousy, which provokes to jealousy, was located.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, the glory of the God of Israel was there, like the appearance which I saw in the plain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Son of man, raise your eyes now toward the north.” So I raised my eyes toward the north, and behold, to the north of the altar gate was this idol of jealousy at the entrance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to me, “Son of man, do you see what they are doing, the great abominations which the house of Israel are committing here, so that I would be far from My sanctuary? But yet you will see still greater abominations!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He brought me to the entrance of the courtyard, and when I looked, behold, a hole in the wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to me, “Son of man, now dig through the wall.” So I dug through the wall, and behold, an entrance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Go in and see the wicked abominations that they are committing here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I entered and looked, and behold, every form of crawling things and animals and detestable things, with all the idols of the house of Israel, were carved on the wall all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And standing in front of them were seventy elders of the house of Israel, with Jaazaniah the son of Shaphan standing among them, each man with his censer in his hand; and the fragrance of the cloud of incense was rising.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Do you see, son of man, what the elders of the house of Israel are doing in the dark, each man in the rooms of his carved images? For they say, ‘The Lord does not see us; the Lord has abandoned the land.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to me, “Yet you will see still greater abominations which they are committing!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He brought me to the entrance of the gate of the Lord’s house which was toward the north; and behold, women were sitting there weeping for Tammuz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to me, “Do you see this, son of man? Yet you will see still greater abominations than these!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He brought me into the inner courtyard of the Lord’s house. And behold, at the entrance to the temple of the Lord, between the porch and the altar, were about twenty-five men with their backs to the temple of the Lord while their faces were toward the east; and they were prostrating themselves eastward toward the sun.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to me, “Do you see this, son of man? Is it a trivial thing for the house of Judah to commit the abominations which they have committed here, that they have filled the land with violence and provoked Me to anger repeatedly? Yet behold, they are putting the twig to their nose!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, I indeed will deal in wrath. My eye will have no pity nor will I spare; and though they cry out in My ears with a loud voice, yet I will not listen to them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He cried out in my presence with a loud voice, saying, “Come forward, you executioners of the city, each with his weapon of destruction in his hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, six men came from the direction of the upper gate which faces north, each with his smashing weapon in his hand; and among them was one man clothed in linen with a scribe’s kit at his waist. And they came in and stood beside the bronze altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the glory of the God of Israel ascended from the cherub on which it had been, to the threshold of the temple. And He called to the man clothed in linen at whose waist was the scribe’s kit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to him, “Go through the midst of the city, through the midst of Jerusalem, and make a mark on the foreheads of the people who groan and sigh over all the abominations which are being committed in its midst.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to the others He said in my presence, “Go through the city after him and strike; do not let your eye have pity and do not spare.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Utterly kill old men, young men, female virgins, little children, and women, but do not touch any person on whom is the mark; and you shall start from My sanctuary.” So they started with the elders who were before the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also said to them, “Defile the temple and fill the courtyards with the dead. Go out!” So they went out and struck and killed the people in the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as they were striking the people and I alone was left, I fell on my face and cried out, saying, “Oh, Lord God! Are You going to destroy the entire remnant of Israel by pouring out Your wrath on Jerusalem?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to me, “The guilt of the house of Israel and Judah is very, very great, and the land is filled with blood, and the city is full of perversion; for they say, ‘The Lord has abandoned the land, and the Lord does not see!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for Me, My eye will have no pity nor will I spare, but I will bring their conduct upon their heads.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then behold, the man clothed in linen, at whose waist was the scribe’s kit, reported, saying, “I have done just as You have commanded me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I looked, and behold, in the expanse that was over the heads of the cherubim something like a sapphire stone, in appearance resembling a throne, appeared above them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He spoke to the man clothed in linen and said, “Enter between the whirling wheels under the cherubim and fill your hands with coals of fire from between the cherubim, and scatter them over the city.” And he entered in my sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the cherubim were standing on the right side of the temple when the man entered, and the cloud filled the inner courtyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the glory of the Lord went up from the cherub to the threshold of the temple, and the temple was filled with the cloud, and the courtyard was filled with the brightness of the glory of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, the sound of the wings of the cherubim was heard as far as the outer courtyard, like the voice of God Almighty when He speaks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it came about when He commanded the man clothed in linen, saying, “Take fire from between the whirling wheels, from between the cherubim,” he entered and stood beside a wheel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the cherub reached out with his hand from between the cherubim to the fire which was between the cherubim, took some coals and put them into the hands of the one clothed in linen; and he took them and went out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cherubim appeared to have something like a human hand under their wings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I looked, and behold, four wheels beside the cherubim, one wheel beside each cherub; and the appearance of the wheels was like the gleam of a Tarshish stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as for their appearance, all four of them had the same likeness, as if one wheel were within another wheel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they moved, they went in any of their four directions without turning as they went; but they followed in the direction which they faced, without turning as they went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And their whole body, their backs, their hands, their wings and the wheels were covered with eyes all around, the wheels belonging to all four of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wheels were called, as I heard, the whirling wheels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And each one had four faces. The first face was the face of a cherub, the second face was the face of a human, the third, the face of a lion, and the fourth, the face of an eagle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the cherubim rose up. They are the living beings that I saw by the river Chebar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the cherubim moved, the wheels would move beside them; also when the cherubim lifted up their wings to rise from the ground, the wheels themselves would not turn away from beside them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the cherubim stood still, the wheels would stand still; and when they rose up, the wheels would rise with them, because the spirit of the living beings was in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the glory of the Lord departed from the threshold of the temple and stood over the cherubim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the cherubim departed, they lifted their wings and rose up from the ground in my sight with the wheels beside them; and they stood still at the entrance of the east gate of the Lord’s house, and the glory of the God of Israel hovered over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the living beings that I saw beneath the God of Israel by the river Chebar; so I knew that they were cherubim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each one had four faces and each one four wings, and beneath their wings was the form of human hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the likeness of their faces, they were the same faces whose appearance I had seen by the river Chebar. Each one went straight ahead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Spirit lifted me up and brought me to the east gate of the Lord’s house which faced eastward. And behold, there were twenty-five men at the entrance of the gate, and among them I saw Jaazaniah son of Azzur and Pelatiah son of Benaiah, leaders of the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Son of man, these are the men who devise wrongdoing and give evil advice in this city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who say, ‘The time is not near to build houses. This city is the pot and we are the meat.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, prophesy against them, prophesy, son of man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Spirit of the Lord fell upon me, and He said to me, “Say, ‘This is what the Lord says: “This is how you think, house of Israel, for I know your thoughts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have multiplied your slain in this city, and filled its streets with them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, this is what the Lord God says: “Your slain whom you have laid in the midst of the city are the meat and this city is the pot; but I will bring you out of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have feared a sword; so I will bring a sword upon you,” the Lord God declares.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And I will bring you out of the midst of the city, and hand you over to strangers, and execute judgments against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will fall by the sword. I will judge you to the border of Israel; so you shall know that I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This city will not be a pot for you, nor will you be meat in the midst of it; I will judge you to the border of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you will know that I am the Lord; for you have not walked in My statutes, nor have you executed My ordinances, but you have acted in accordance with the ordinances of the nations around you.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came about, as I prophesied, that Pelatiah son of Benaiah died. Then I fell on my face and cried out with a loud voice, and said, “Oh, Lord God! Will You bring the remnant of Israel to a complete destruction?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, your brothers, your relatives, your fellow exiles, and the entire house of Israel, all of them, are those to whom the inhabitants of Jerusalem have said, ‘Keep far from the Lord; this land has been given to us as a possession.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore say, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “Though I had removed them far away among the nations, and though I had scattered them among the countries, yet I was a sanctuary for them for a little while in the countries where they had gone.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore say, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “I will gather you from the peoples and assemble you from the countries among which you have been scattered, and I will give you the land of Israel.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they come there, they will remove all its detestable things and all its abominations from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will give them one heart, and put a new spirit within them. And I will remove the heart of stone from their flesh and give them a heart of flesh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that they may walk in My statutes, and keep My ordinances and do them. Then they will be My people, and I shall be their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for those whose hearts go after their detestable things and abominations, I will bring their conduct down on their heads,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the cherubim lifted up their wings with the wheels beside them, and the glory of the God of Israel hovered over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The glory of the Lord went up from the midst of the city and stood over the mountain which is east of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Spirit lifted me up and brought me in a vision by the Spirit of God to Chaldea, to the exiles. Then the vision that I had seen left me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I told the exiles all the things that the Lord had shown me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, you live in the midst of the rebellious house, who have eyes to see but do not see, ears to hear but do not hear; for they are a rebellious house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So as for you, son of man, prepare for yourself baggage for exile and go into exile by day in their sight; that is, go into exile from your place to another place in their sight. Perhaps they will understand, though they are a rebellious house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bring your baggage out by day in their sight, as baggage for exile. Then you shall go out at evening in their sight, as those who are going into exile.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dig a hole through the wall in their sight and go out through it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Load the baggage on your shoulder in their sight and carry it out in the dark. You shall cover your face so that you cannot see the land, for I have set you as a sign to the house of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I did so, just as I had been commanded. By day I brought out my baggage like the baggage of an exile. Then in the evening I dug through the wall with my hands; I went out in the dark and carried the baggage on my shoulder in their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the morning the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, has the house of Israel, the rebellious house, not said to you, ‘What are you doing?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to them, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “This pronouncement concerns the prince in Jerusalem as well as all the house of Israel who are in it.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say, ‘I am a sign to you. Just as I have done, so it will be done to them; they will go into exile, into captivity.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The prince who is among them will load his baggage on his shoulder in the dark and go out. They will dig a hole through the wall to bring it out through it. He will cover his face so that he cannot see the land with his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will also spread My net over him, and he will be caught in My net. And I will bring him to Babylon in the land of the Chaldeans; yet he will not see it, though he will die there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will scatter to every wind all who are around him, his helpers and all his troops; and I will draw out a sword after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they will know that I am the Lord, when I disperse them among the nations and scatter them among the countries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will spare a few of them from the sword, the famine, and plague so that they may tell of all their abominations among the nations where they go, and may know that I am the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, eat your bread with trembling, and drink your water with quivering and anxiety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then say to the people of the land, ‘This is what the Lord God says concerning the inhabitants of Jerusalem in the land of Israel: “They will eat their bread with anxiety and drink their water with horror, because their land will be stripped of its fullness on account of the violence of all who live in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The inhabited cities will be in ruins, and the land will be a desolation. So you will know that I am the Lord.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, what is this proverb you people have about the land of Israel, saying, ‘The days are long, and every vision fails’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore say to them, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “I will put an end to this proverb so that they will no longer use it as a proverb in Israel.” But tell them, “The days are approaching as well as the fulfillment of every vision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there will no longer be any false vision or deceptive divination within the house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I the Lord will speak whatever word I speak, and it will be performed. It will no longer be delayed, for in your days, you rebellious house, I will speak the word and perform it,” declares the Lord God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, behold, the house of Israel is saying, ‘The vision that he sees is for many years from now, and he prophesies of times far off.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore say to them, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “None of My words will be delayed any longer. Whatever word I speak will be performed,”’” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, prophesy against the prophets of Israel who prophesy, and say to those who prophesy from their own inspiration, ‘Listen to the word of the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord God says: “Woe to the foolish prophets who are following their own spirit and have seen nothing!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Israel, your prophets have been like jackals among ruins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have not gone up into the breaches, nor did you build up a stone wall around the house of Israel to stand in the battle on the day of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They see deceit and lying divination, those who are saying, ‘The Lord declares,’ when the Lord has not sent them; yet they wait for the fulfillment of their word!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did you not see a false vision and tell a lying divination when you said, ‘The Lord declares,’ but it is not I who have spoken?”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, this is what the Lord God says: “Because you have spoken deceit and have seen a lie, therefore behold, I am against you,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So My hand will be against the prophets who see false visions and utter lying divinations. They will have no place in the council of My people, nor will they be written down in the register of the house of Israel, nor will they enter the land of Israel, so that you may know that I am the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is definitely because they have misled My people by saying, ‘Peace!’ when there is no peace. And when anyone builds a wall, behold, they plaster it over with whitewash;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so tell those who plaster it over with whitewash, that it will fall. A flooding rain will come, and you, hailstones, will fall, and a violent wind will break out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, when the wall has fallen, will you not be asked, ‘Where is the plaster with which you plastered it?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, this is what the Lord God says: “I will make a violent wind break out in My wrath. There will also be in My anger a flooding rain and hailstones to consume it in wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will tear down the wall which you plastered over with whitewash and hurl it down to the ground, so that its foundation is exposed; and when it falls, you will perish in its midst. And you will know that I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will expend My wrath on the wall and on those who have plastered it over with whitewash; and I will say to you, ‘The wall is gone and those who plastered it are gone,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: along with the prophets of Israel who prophesy to Jerusalem, and who see a vision of peace for her when there is no peace,’ declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now you, son of man, set your face against the daughters of your people who are talking like prophets from their own imagination. Prophesy against them
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “Woe to the women who sew magic bands on all wrists and make veils for the heads of persons of every stature to capture souls! Will you capture the souls of My people, but keep the souls of others alive for yourselves?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For handfuls of barley and pieces of bread, you have profaned Me to My people, to put to death some who should not die, and to keep others alive who should not live, by your lying to My people who listen to lies.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, this is what the Lord God says: “Behold, I am against your magic bands by which you capture souls there as birds, and I will tear them from your arms; and I will let them go, those souls whom you capture as birds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will also tear off your veils and save My people from your hands, and they will no longer be in your hands as prey; and you will know that I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because you disheartened the righteous with falsehood when I did not cause him pain, but you have encouraged the wicked not to turn from his wicked way to keep him alive,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore you women will no longer see deceitful visions or practice divination, and I will save My people from your hands. So you will know that I am the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some elders of Israel came to me and sat down before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, these men have set up their idols in their hearts and have put in front of their faces the stumbling block of their wrongdoing. Should I let Myself be consulted by them at all?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore speak to them and tell them, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “Anyone of the house of Israel who sets up his idols in his heart, puts in front of his face the stumbling block of his wrongdoing, and then comes to the prophet, I the Lord will let Myself answer him in the matter in view of the multitude of his idols,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order to take hold of the hearts of the house of Israel who have turned away from Me due to all their idols.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore say to the house of Israel, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “Repent and turn away from your idols, and turn your faces away from all your abominations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For anyone of the house of Israel, or of the strangers who reside in Israel, who deserts Me, sets up his idols in his heart, puts in front of his face the stumbling block of his wrongdoing, and then comes to the prophet to request something of Me for himself, I the Lord will let Myself answer him Myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will set My face against that person and make him a sign and a proverb, and I will eliminate him from among My people. So you will know that I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if the prophet is persuaded so that he speaks a word, it is I, the Lord, who have persuaded that prophet; and I will stretch out My hand against him and eliminate him from among My people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they will bear the punishment for their wrongdoing; as the wrongdoing of the inquirer is, so the wrongdoing of the prophet will be,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in order that the house of Israel may no longer stray from Me and no longer defile themselves with all their offenses. So they will be My people, and I shall be their God,”’ declares the Lord God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, if a country sins against Me by being unfaithful, and I stretch out My hand against it, destroy its supply of bread, send famine against it, and eliminate from it both human and animal life,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even though these three men, Noah, Daniel, and Job were in its midst, by their own righteousness they could only save themselves,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If I were to cause vicious animals to pass through the land and they depopulated it, and it became desolate so that no one would pass through it because of the animals,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: though these three men were in its midst, as I live,” declares the Lord God, “they could not save either their sons or their daughters. They alone would be saved, but the country would be desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if I were to bring a sword on that country and say, ‘A sword is to pass through the country,’ and I eliminated human and animal life from it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even though these three men were in its midst, as I live,” declares the Lord God, “they could not save either their sons or their daughters, but they alone would be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if I were to send a plague against that country and pour out My wrath on it in blood to eliminate man and animal from it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: even though Noah, Daniel, and Job were in its midst, as I live,” declares the Lord God, “they could not save either their son or their daughter. They would save only themselves by their righteousness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is what the Lord God says: “How much more when I send My four severe judgments against Jerusalem: sword, famine, vicious animals, and plague to eliminate human and animal life from it!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet, behold, survivors will be left in it who will be brought out, both sons and daughters. Behold, they are going to come out to you, and you will see their conduct and actions; then you will be comforted for the disaster which I have brought against Jerusalem for everything which I have brought upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will comfort you when you see their conduct and actions, for you will know that I have not done without reason whatever I did to it,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, how is the wood of the vine better than any wood of a branch which is among the trees of the forest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can wood be taken from it to make anything, or can even a peg be taken from it on which to hang any utensil?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it has been put into the fire for fuel, and the fire has consumed both of its ends and its middle part has been charred, is it then good for anything?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, while it is intact, it is not made into anything. How much less, when the fire has consumed it and it is charred, can it still be made into anything!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, this is what the Lord God says: ‘As the wood of the vine among the trees of the forest, which I have given to the fire for fuel, so have I given up the inhabitants of Jerusalem;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I set My face against them. Though they have come out of the fire, yet the fire will consume them. Then you will know that I am the Lord, when I set My face against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will make the land desolate, because they have acted unfaithfully,’” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, make known to Jerusalem her abominations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say, ‘This is what the Lord God says to Jerusalem: “Your origin and your birth are from the land of the Canaanite; your father was an Amorite and your mother a Hittite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for your birth, on the day you were born your navel cord was not cut, nor were you washed with water for cleansing; you were not rubbed with salt or even wrapped in cloths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No eye looked with pity on you to do any of these things for you, to have compassion on you. Rather you were thrown out into the open field, for you were abhorred on the day you were born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When I passed by you and saw you squirming in your blood, I said to you while you were in your blood, ‘Live!’ Yes, I said to you while you were in your blood, ‘Live!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I made you very numerous, like plants of the field. Then you grew up, became tall and reached the age for fine jewelry; your breasts were formed and your hair had grown. Yet you were naked and bare.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then I passed by you and saw you, and behold, you were at the time for love; so I spread My garment over you and covered your nakedness. I also swore an oath to you and entered into a covenant with you so that you became Mine,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then I bathed you with water, washed off your blood from you, and anointed you with oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also clothed you with colorfully woven cloth and put sandals of fine leather on your feet; and I wrapped you with fine linen and covered you with silk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I adorned you with jewelry, put bracelets on your wrists, and a necklace around your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also put a ring in your nose, earrings in your ears, and a beautiful crown on your head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you were adorned with gold and silver, and your dress was of fine linen, silk, and colorfully woven cloth. You ate fine flour, honey, and oil; so you were exceedingly beautiful and advanced to royalty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then your fame spread among the nations on account of your beauty, for it was perfect because of My splendor which I bestowed on you,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But you trusted in your beauty and became unfaithful because of your fame, and you poured out your obscene practices on every passer-by to whom it might be tempting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You took some of your clothes, made for yourself high places of various colors, and committed prostitution on them, which should not come about nor happen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You also took your beautiful jewels made of My gold and of My silver, which I had given you, and made for yourself male images so that you might commit prostitution with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you took your colorfully woven cloth and covered them, and offered My oil and My incense before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also My bread which I gave you, fine flour, oil, and honey with which I fed you, you would offer before them for a soothing aroma; so it happened,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Furthermore, you took your sons and daughters whom you had borne to Me and sacrificed them to idols to be devoured. Were your obscene practices a trivial matter?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You slaughtered My children and offered them to idols by making them pass through the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And besides all your abominations and obscene practices, you did not remember the days of your youth, when you were naked and bare and squirming in your blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then it came about after all your wickedness (‘Woe, woe to you!’ declares the Lord God),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that you built yourself a shrine and made yourself a high place in every public square.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You built yourself a high place at the beginning of every street and made your beauty abominable, and you spread your legs to every passer-by and multiplied your obscene practice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You also committed prostitution with the Egyptians, your lustful neighbors, and multiplied your obscene practice to provoke Me to anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So behold, I have stretched out My hand against you and cut back your rations. And I turned you over to the desire of those who hate you, the daughters of the Philistines, who are ashamed of your outrageous conduct.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, you committed prostitution with the Assyrians because you were not satisfied; you committed prostitution with them and still were not satisfied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You also multiplied your obscene practice with the land of merchants, Chaldea; yet even with this you were not satisfied.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How feverish is your heart,” declares the Lord God, “while you do all these things, the action of a bold prostitute!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you built your shrine at the beginning of every street and made your high place in every public square, in spurning a prostitute’s fee, you were not like a prostitute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You adulteress wife, who takes strangers instead of her husband!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men give gifts to all prostitutes, but you give your gifts to all your lovers and lavish favors on them so that they will come to you from every direction for your obscene practices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it is the opposite for you from those women in your obscene practices, in that you are not approached for prostitution, and in the fact that you pay a prostitute’s fee, and no fee is paid to you; so you are the opposite.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, you prostitute, hear the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord God says: “Because your lewdness was poured out and your nakedness uncovered through your obscene practices with your lovers and with all your detestable idols, and because of the blood of your sons that you gave to idols,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, behold, I am going to gather all your lovers whom you pleased, all those whom you loved as well as all those whom you hated. So I will gather them against you from every direction and expose your nakedness to them so that they may see all your nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will judge you as women who commit adultery or shed blood are judged; and I will bring on you the blood of wrath and jealousy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will also hand you over to your lovers, and they will tear down your shrines, demolish your high places, strip you of your clothing, take away your jewels, and will leave you naked and bare.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will incite a crowd against you, and they will stone you and cut you to pieces with their swords.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they will burn your houses with fire and execute judgments against you in the sight of many women. Then I will put an end to your prostitution, and you will also no longer pay your lovers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will satisfy My fury against you and My jealousy will leave you, and I will be pacified and no longer be angry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since you have not remembered the days of your youth but have caused Me unrest by all these things, behold, I in turn will bring your conduct down on your own head,” declares the Lord God, “so that you will not commit this outrageous sin in addition to all your other abominations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, everyone who quotes proverbs will quote this proverb about you, saying, ‘Like mother, like daughter.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are the daughter of your mother, who loathed her husband and children. You are also the sister of your sisters, who loathed their husbands and children. Your mother was a Hittite and your father an Amorite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now your older sister is Samaria, who lives north of you with her daughters; and your younger sister, who lives south of you, is Sodom with her daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet you have not merely walked in their ways and committed their abominations; but, as if that were too little, you also acted more corruptly in all your conduct than they.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As I live,” declares the Lord God, “Sodom, your sister and her daughters have not done as you and your daughters have done!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, this was the guilt of your sister Sodom: she and her daughters had arrogance, plenty of food, and carefree ease, but she did not help the poor and needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they were haughty and committed abominations before Me. Therefore I removed them when I saw it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, Samaria did not commit half of your sins, for you have multiplied your abominations more than they. So you have made your sisters appear innocent by all your abominations which you have committed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also, bear your disgrace in that you have made judgment favorable for your sisters. Because of your sins in which you acted more abominably than they, they are more in the right than you. Yes, be also ashamed and bear your disgrace, in that you made your sisters appear innocent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Nevertheless, I will restore their fortunes, the fortunes of Sodom and her daughters, the fortunes of Samaria and her daughters, and along with them your own fortunes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you will bear your disgrace and feel ashamed for all that you have done when you become a consolation to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your sisters, Sodom with her daughters and Samaria with her daughters, will return to their former state, and you with your daughters will also return to your former state.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the name of your sister Sodom was not heard from your lips in your day of pride,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: before your wickedness was uncovered, so now you have become the disgrace of the daughters of Edom and of all who are around her, of the daughters of the Philistines—those surrounding you who despise you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have suffered the penalty of your outrageous sin and abominations,” the Lord declares.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is what the Lord God says: “I will also do with you as you have done, you who have despised the oath by breaking the covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Nevertheless, I will remember My covenant with you in the days of your youth, and I will establish an everlasting covenant with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will remember your ways and be ashamed when you receive your sisters, both your older and your younger; and I will give them to you as daughters, but not because of your covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will establish My covenant with you, and you shall know that I am the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that you may remember and be ashamed, and not open your mouth again because of your disgrace, when I have forgiven you for all that you have done,” the Lord God declares.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, ask a riddle and present a parable to the house of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “A great eagle with great wings, long pinions, and a full plumage of many colors came to Lebanon and took away the top of the cedar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He broke off the topmost of its young twigs and brought it to a land of merchants; he set it in a city of traders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also took from the seed of the land and planted it in fertile soil, a meadow beside abundant waters; he set it like a willow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it sprouted and became a low, spreading vine with its branches turned toward him, but its roots remained under it. So it became a vine and produced shoots and sent out branches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But there was another great eagle with great wings and much plumage; and behold, this vine turned its roots toward him and sent out its branches toward him from the beds where it was planted, so that he might water it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was planted in good soil beside abundant waters, so that it would produce branches and bear fruit, and become a splendid vine.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “Will it thrive? Will he not pull up its roots and cut off its fruit, so that it withers—so that all its sprouting shoots wither? And neither by great strength nor by many people can it be raised from its roots again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, though it is planted, will it thrive? Will it not completely wither as soon as the east wind strikes it—wither on the beds where it grew?”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Say now to the rebellious house, ‘Do you not know what these things mean?’ Say, ‘Behold, the king of Babylon came to Jerusalem, took its king and leaders, and brought them to him in Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took one of the royal family and made a covenant with him, putting him under oath. He also took away the mighty of the land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that the kingdom would be humbled, not exalting itself, but keeping his covenant so that it might continue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he revolted against him by sending his messengers to Egypt so that they might give him horses and many troops. Will he succeed? Will he who does these things escape? Can he indeed break the covenant and escape?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As I live,’ declares the Lord God, ‘In the country of the king who put him on the throne, whose oath he despised and whose covenant he broke, in Babylon he shall certainly die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pharaoh with his mighty army and great contingent will not help him in the war, when they pile up assault ramps and build siege walls to eliminate many lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he despised the oath by breaking the covenant, and behold, he pledged his allegiance, yet did all these things; he shall not escape.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, this is what the Lord God says: “As I live, My oath which he despised and My covenant which he broke, I will certainly inflict on his head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will spread My net over him, and he will be caught in My net. Then I will bring him to Babylon and enter into judgment with him there regarding the unfaithful act which he has committed against Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the choice men in all his troops will fall by the sword, and the survivors will be scattered to every wind; and you will know that I, the Lord, have spoken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord God says: “I will also take a sprig from the lofty top of the cedar and set it out; I will break off from the topmost of its young twigs a tender one, and I will plant it on a high and lofty mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the high mountain of Israel I will plant it, so that it may bring forth branches and bear fruit, and become a stately cedar. And birds of every kind will nest under it; they will nest in the shade of its branches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the trees of the field will know that I am the Lord; I bring down the high tree, exalt the low tree, dry up the green tree, and make the dry tree flourish. I am the Lord; I have spoken, and I will perform it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What do you people mean by using this proverb about the land of Israel, saying,
‘The fathers eat sour grapes,
But it is the children’s teeth that have become blunt’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As I live,” declares the Lord God, “you certainly are not going to use this proverb in Israel anymore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, all souls are Mine; the soul of the father as well as the soul of the son is Mine. The soul who sins will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if a man is righteous and practices justice and righteousness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if he does not eat at the mountain shrines or raise his eyes to the idols of the house of Israel, or defile his neighbor’s wife or approach a woman during her menstrual period—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if a man does not oppress anyone, but restores to the debtor his pledge, does not commit robbery, but gives his bread to the hungry and covers the naked with clothing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if he does not lend money at interest or take interest, if he keeps his hand from injustice and executes true justice between one person and another,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if he walks in My statutes and keeps My ordinances so as to deal faithfully—he is righteous and will certainly live,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “However, he may father a violent son who sheds blood, and does any one of these things to a brother
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (though he himself did not do any of these things), that is, he even eats at the mountain shrines, and defiles his neighbor’s wife,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: oppresses the poor and needy, commits robbery, does not restore a pledge, but raises his eyes to the idols and commits abomination,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: lends money at interest and takes interest; will he live? He will not live! He has committed all these abominations, he shall certainly be put to death; his blood will be on himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now behold, he has fathered a son who saw all his father’s sins which he committed, but he has seen them and does not do likewise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He does not eat at the mountain shrines or raise his eyes to the idols of the house of Israel; he has not defiled his neighbor’s wife,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor oppressed anyone, nor retained a pledge, nor committed robbery; instead, he gives his bread to the hungry and covers the naked with clothing,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he keeps his hand from the poor, does not take any kind of interest on loans, but executes My ordinances, and walks in My statutes; he will not die for his father’s guilt, he will certainly live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for his father, because he practiced extortion, robbed his brother, and did what was not good among his people, behold, he will die for his guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yet you say, ‘Why should the son not suffer the punishment for the father’s guilt?’ When the son has practiced justice and righteousness and has kept all My statutes and done them, he shall certainly live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who sins will die. A son will not suffer the punishment for the father’s guilt, nor will a father suffer the punishment for the son’s guilt; the righteousness of the righteous will be upon himself, and the wickedness of the wicked will be upon himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But if the wicked person turns from all his sins which he has committed and keeps all My statutes and practices justice and righteousness, he shall certainly live; he shall not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All his offenses which he has committed will not be remembered against him; because of his righteousness which he has practiced, he will live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do I take any pleasure in the death of the wicked,” declares the Lord God, “rather than that he would turn from his ways and live?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But when a righteous person turns away from his righteousness, commits injustice and does according to all the abominations that the wicked person does, will he live? All his righteous deeds which he has done will not be remembered for his treachery which he has committed and his sin which he has committed; for them he will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet you say, ‘The way of the Lord is not right.’ Hear now, house of Israel! Is My way not right? Is it not your ways that are not right?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a righteous person turns away from his righteousness, commits injustice and dies because of it, for his injustice which he has committed he dies.
verses.speaker: Narrator
