verses.text: But when a wicked person turns away from his wickedness which he has committed and practices justice and righteousness, he will save his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since he understood and turned away from all his offenses which he had committed, he shall certainly live; he shall not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the house of Israel says, ‘The way of the Lord is not right.’ Are My ways not right, house of Israel? Is it not your ways that are not right?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore I will judge you, house of Israel, each according to his conduct,” declares the Lord God. “Repent and turn away from all your offenses, so that wrongdoing does not become a stumbling block to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hurl away from you all your offenses which you have committed and make yourselves a new heart and a new spirit! For why should you die, house of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I take no pleasure in the death of anyone who dies,” declares the Lord God. “Therefore, repent and live!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for you, take up a song of mourning for the leaders of Israel
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and say,
‘What was your mother?
A lioness among lions!
She lay down among young lions,
She raised her cubs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When she brought up one of her cubs,
He became a young lion,
And he learned to tear his prey;
He devoured people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then nations heard about him;
He was caught in their trap,
And they brought him with hooks
To the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When she saw, as she waited,
That her hope was lost,
She took another of her cubs
And made him a young lion.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He destroyed their palaces
And laid waste their cities;
And the land and its fullness were appalled
Because of the sound of his roaring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then nations set against him
On every side from their provinces,
And they spread their net over him;
He was caught in their trap.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They put him in a wooden collar with hooks
And brought him to the king of Babylon;
They brought him in hunting nets
So that his voice would no longer be heard
On the mountains of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your mother was like a vine in your vineyard,
Planted by the waters;
It was fruitful and thick with branches
Because of abundant waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And it had strong stems fit for scepters of rulers,
And its height was raised above the clouds
So that it was seen in its height with the mass of its branches.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And now it is planted in the wilderness,
In a dry and thirsty land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And fire has gone out from its stem;
It has consumed its shoots and fruit,
So that there is no strong stem in it,
A scepter to rule.’”
This is a song of mourning, and has become a song of mourning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the seventh year, in the fifth month, on the tenth of the month, men from the elders of Israel came to inquire of the Lord, and they sat before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, speak to the elders of Israel and say to them, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “Do you yourselves come to inquire of Me? As I live,” declares the Lord God, “I certainly will not be inquired of by you.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will you judge them, will you judge them, son of man? Make known to them the abominations of their fathers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say to them, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “On the day when I chose Israel and swore to the descendants of the house of Jacob and made Myself known to them in the land of Egypt, when I swore to them, saying, I am the Lord your God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: on that day I swore to them, to bring them out from the land of Egypt into a land that I had selected for them, flowing with milk and honey, which is the glory of all the lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I said to them, ‘Throw away, each of you, the detestable things of his eyes, and do not defile yourselves with the idols of Egypt; I am the Lord your God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they rebelled against Me and were not willing to listen to Me; they did not throw away, each of them, the detestable things of their eyes, nor did they abandon the idols of Egypt.
“Then I resolved to pour out My wrath on them, to use up My anger against them in the midst of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I acted for the sake of My name, that it would not be defiled in the sight of the nations among whom they lived, in whose sight I made Myself known to them by bringing them out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I took them out of the land of Egypt and brought them into the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave them My statutes and informed them of My ordinances, which, if a person follows them, then he will live by them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also I gave them My Sabbaths to be a sign between Me and them, so that they might know that I am the Lord who sanctifies them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the house of Israel rebelled against Me in the wilderness. They did not walk in My statutes and they rejected My ordinances, which, if a person follows them, then he will live by them; and they greatly profaned My Sabbaths. Then I resolved to pour out My wrath on them in the wilderness, to annihilate them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I acted for the sake of My name, so that it would not be defiled before the eyes of the nations, before whose eyes I had brought them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also I swore to them in the wilderness that I would not bring them into the land which I had given them, flowing with milk and honey, which is the glory of all the lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they rejected My ordinances, and as for My statutes, they did not walk in them; they also profaned My Sabbaths, because their heart continually followed their idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet My eye spared them rather than destroying them, and I did not bring about their annihilation in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Instead, I said to their children in the wilderness, ‘Do not walk in the statutes of your fathers or keep their ordinances or defile yourselves with their idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Lord your God; walk in My statutes and keep My ordinances and follow them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sanctify My Sabbaths; and they shall be a sign between Me and you, so that you may know that I am the Lord your God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the children rebelled against Me; they did not walk in My statutes, nor were they careful to follow My ordinances which, if a person follows them, then he will live by them; they profaned My Sabbaths. So I resolved to pour out My wrath on them, to use up My anger against them in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I withdrew My hand and acted for the sake of My name, so that it would not be defiled in the sight of the nations in whose sight I had brought them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also I swore to them in the wilderness that I would scatter them among the nations and disperse them among the lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they had not complied with My ordinances, but had rejected My statutes and had profaned My Sabbaths, and their eyes were on the idols of their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also gave them statutes that were not good, and ordinances by which they could not live;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I pronounced them unclean because of their gifts, in that they made all their firstborn pass through the fire so that I might make them desolate, in order that they might know that I am the Lord.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore speak to the house of Israel, son of man, and say to them, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “Again, in this your fathers have blasphemed Me by being disloyal to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I had brought them into the land which I swore to give to them, then they saw every high hill and every tree thick with branches, and there they offered their sacrifices and there they presented the provocation of their offering. There also they made their soothing aroma and there they poured out their drink offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said to them, ‘What is the high place to which you go?’ So its name is called Bamah to this day.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, say to the house of Israel, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “Will you defile yourselves in the way of your fathers and adulterously pursue their detestable things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when you offer your gifts, when you make your sons pass through the fire, you are defiling yourselves with all your idols to this day. So shall I be inquired of by you, house of Israel? As I live,” declares the Lord God, “I certainly will not be inquired of by you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And whatever comes into your mind certainly will not come about, when you say: ‘We will be like the nations, like the families of the lands, serving wood and stone.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As I live,” declares the Lord God, “with a mighty hand and with an outstretched arm and with wrath poured out, I assuredly shall be king over you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring you out from the peoples and gather you from the lands where you are scattered, with a mighty hand and with an outstretched arm and with wrath poured out;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I will bring you into the wilderness of the peoples, and there I will enter into judgment with you face to face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as I entered into judgment with your fathers in the wilderness of the land of Egypt, so I will enter into judgment with you,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will make you pass under the rod, and I will bring you into the bond of the covenant;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I will purge from you the rebels and those who revolt against Me; I will bring them out of the land where they reside, but they will not enter the land of Israel. So you will know that I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for you, house of Israel,” this is what the Lord God says: “Go, serve, everyone of you his idols; but later you will certainly listen to Me, and My holy name you will no longer defile with your gifts and your idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For on My holy mountain, on the high mountain of Israel,” declares the Lord God, “there the entire house of Israel, all of them, will serve Me in the land; there I will accept them and there I will demand your contributions and the choicest of your gifts, with all your holy things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a soothing aroma I will accept you when I bring you out from the peoples and gather you from the lands where you are scattered; and I will show Myself to be holy among you in the sight of the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will know that I am the Lord, when I bring you into the land of Israel, into the land which I swore to give to your forefathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there you will remember your ways and all your deeds by which you have defiled yourselves; and you will loathe yourselves in your own sight for all the evil things that you have done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will know that I am the Lord, when I have dealt with you in behalf of My name, not according to your evil ways or according to your corrupt deeds, house of Israel,” declares the Lord God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, set your face toward the south, and speak prophetically against the south and prophesy against the forest land of the Negev,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say to the forest of the Negev, ‘Hear the word of the Lord: this is what the Lord God says: “Behold, I am going to kindle a fire in you, and it will consume every green tree in you, as well as every dry tree; the blazing flame will not go out and the entire surface from south to north will be scorched by it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all mankind will see that I, the Lord, have kindled it; it will not go out.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, “Oh, Lord God! They are saying of me, ‘Is he not just speaking in riddles?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, set your face against Jerusalem, and speak prophetically against the sanctuaries and prophesy against the land of Israel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say to the land of Israel, ‘This is what the Lord says: “Behold, I am against you; and I will draw My sword from its sheath and cut off from you the righteous and the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because I will cut off from you the righteous and the wicked, therefore My sword will go out from its sheath against humanity from south to north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So humanity will know that I, the Lord, have drawn My sword from its sheath. It will not return to its sheath again.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for you, son of man, groan with a breaking heart and bitter grief; you shall groan in their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they say to you, ‘Why are you groaning?’ you shall say, ‘Because of the news, for it is coming; and every heart will melt, all hands will go limp, every spirit will be disheartened, and all knees will drip with water. Behold, it is coming and it will happen,’ declares the Lord God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Son of man, prophesy and say, ‘This is what the Lord says:’ Say,
‘A sword, a sword sharpened
And also polished!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sharpened to make a slaughter,
Polished to flash like lightning!’
Or shall we rejoice, the rod of My son despising every tree?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it is given to be polished, so that it may be handled; the sword is sharpened and polished, to hand it over to the slaughterer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cry out and wail, son of man; for it is against My people, it is against all the officials of Israel. They are turned over to the sword with My people, therefore slap your thigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there is a testing; and what if even the rod which despises will cease to be?” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You therefore, son of man, prophesy and clap your hands; and let the sword be doubled the third time, the sword for the slain. It is the sword for the great one slain, which surrounds them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that their hearts will waver, and many fall at all their gates. I have granted the slaughter of the sword. Oh! It is made for striking like lightning, it is sharpened in readiness for slaughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Prove yourself sharp, go to the right; set yourself; go to the left, wherever your edge is ordered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will also clap My hands, and I will satisfy My wrath; I, the Lord, have spoken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now as for you, son of man, make two ways for the sword of the king of Babylon to come; both of them will go out of one land. And make a signpost; make it at the head of the way to the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall mark a way for the sword to come to Rabbah of the sons of Ammon, and to Judah into fortified Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the king of Babylon stands at the parting of the way, at the head of the two ways, to use divination; he shakes the arrows, he consults the household idols, he looks at the liver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Into his right hand came the divination, ‘Jerusalem,’ to set up battering rams, to open the mouth for slaughter, to raise the voice with a battle cry, to set up battering rams against the gates, to pile up assault ramps, to build a siege wall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it will be to them like a false divination in their eyes; they have sworn solemn oaths. But he makes guilt known, so that they may be seized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, this is what the Lord God says: ‘Because you have made your guilt known, in that your offenses are uncovered, so that in all your deeds your sins are seen—because you have come to mind, you will be seized by the hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, slain, wicked one, the prince of Israel, whose day has come, in the time of the punishment of the end,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: this is what the Lord God says: ‘Remove the turban and take off the crown; this will no longer be the same. Exalt that which is low, and humble that which is high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ruins, ruins, ruins, I will make it! This also will be no longer until He comes whose right it is, and I will give it to Him.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you, son of man, prophesy and say, ‘This is what the Lord God says concerning the sons of Ammon and their taunting,’ and say: ‘A sword, a sword is drawn, sharpened for the slaughter, to make it consume, so that it may be like lightning—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while they see false visions for you, while they divine lies for you—to place you on the necks of the wicked who are killed, whose day has come, in the time of the punishment of the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Return it to its sheath. In the place where you were created, in the land of your origin, I will judge you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will pour out My indignation on you; I will blow on you with the fire of My wrath, and I will hand you over to brutal men, craftsmen of destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will be fuel for the fire; your blood will be in the midst of the land. You will not be remembered, for I, the Lord, have spoken.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you, son of man, will you judge, will you judge the bloody city? Then inform her of all her abominations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall say, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “A city shedding blood in her midst, so that her time is coming; and a city that makes idols, contrary to her own good, for defilement!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have become guilty by the blood which you have shed, and you have become defiled by your idols which you have made. So you have brought your days closer and have come to your years; therefore I have made you a disgrace to the nations, and an object of mocking to all the lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who are near and those who are far from you will make fun of you, you of ill repute, full of turmoil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, the rulers of Israel, each according to his power, have been among you for the purpose of shedding blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have treated father and mother with contempt among you. They have oppressed the stranger in your midst; they have oppressed the orphan and the widow among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have despised My holy things and profaned My Sabbaths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Slanderous men have been among you for the purpose of shedding blood, and among you they have eaten at the mountain shrines. In your midst they have committed outrageous sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among you they have uncovered their fathers’ nakedness; among you they have abused her who was unclean in her menstruation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And one has committed abomination with his neighbor’s wife, another has outrageously defiled his daughter-in-law, and another among you has sexually abused his sister, his father’s daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among you they have taken bribes to shed blood; you have taken interest, you have injured your neighbors by oppression, and you have forgotten Me,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, then, I strike with My hand your profit which you have made and the bloodshed which is among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can your heart endure, or can your hands be strong for the days that I will deal with you? I, the Lord, have spoken and will act.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will scatter you among the nations and disperse you among the lands, and I will eliminate your uncleanness from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will defile yourself in the sight of the nations, and you will know that I am the Lord.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, the house of Israel has become waste metal to Me; all of them are bronze, tin, iron, and lead in the smelting furnace; they are the waste metal of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, this is what the Lord God says: ‘Because all of you have become waste metal, therefore, behold, I am going to gather you into the midst of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they gather silver, bronze, iron, lead, and tin into the smelting furnace to blow fire on it in order to melt it, so I will gather you in My anger and in My wrath, and I will place you there and melt you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will gather you and blow on you with the fire of My wrath, and you will be melted in the midst of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As silver is melted in the furnace, so you will be melted in the midst of it; and you will know that I, the Lord, have poured out My wrath on you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, say to her, ‘You are a land that is not clean or rained on in the day of indignation.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is a conspiracy of her prophets in her midst like a roaring lion tearing the prey. They have devoured lives; they have taken treasure and precious things; they have made many widows in the midst of her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her priests have done violence to My Law and have profaned My holy things; they have made no distinction between the holy and the common, and they have not taught the difference between the unclean and the clean; and they have closed their eyes from My Sabbaths, and I am defiled among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her leaders within her are like wolves tearing the prey, by shedding blood and destroying lives in order to make dishonest profit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And her prophets have coated with whitewash for them, seeing false visions and divining lies for them, saying, ‘This is what the Lord God says,’ when the Lord has not spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of the land have practiced extortion and committed robbery, and they have oppressed the poor and needy, and have oppressed the stranger without justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I searched for a man among them who would build up a wall and stand in the gap before Me for the land, so that I would not destroy it; but I found no one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I have poured out My indignation on them; I have consumed them with the fire of My wrath; I have brought their way upon their heads,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to me again, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, there were two women, the daughters of one mother;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they prostituted themselves in Egypt. They prostituted themselves in their youth; there their breasts were squeezed and there their virgin breasts were handled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their names were Oholah the elder and Oholibah her sister. And they became Mine, and they gave birth to sons and daughters. And as for their names, Samaria is Oholah and Jerusalem is Oholibah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Oholah prostituted herself while she was Mine; and she lusted after her lovers, after the Assyrians, her neighbors,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who were clothed in purple, governors and officials, all of them handsome young men, horsemen riding on horses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She bestowed her obscene practices on them, all of whom were the choicest men of Assyria; and with all whom she lusted after, with all their idols she defiled herself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She did not abandon her obscene practices from the time in Egypt; for in her youth men had slept with her, and they handled her virgin breasts and poured out their obscene practice on her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, I handed her over to her lovers, to the Assyrians, after whom she lusted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They uncovered her nakedness; they took her sons and her daughters, but they killed her with the sword. So she became a subject of gossip among women, and they executed judgments on her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now her sister Oholibah saw this, yet she was more corrupt in her lust than she, and her obscene practices were more than the prostitution of her sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She lusted after the Assyrians, governors and officials, the ones near, opulently dressed, horsemen riding on horses, all of them handsome young men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I saw that she had defiled herself; they both took the same way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she increased her obscene practices. And she saw men carved on the wall, images of the Chaldeans drawn in bright red,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: wearing belts around their waists, with flowing turbans on their heads, all of them looking like officers, like the Babylonians in Chaldea, the land of their birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she saw them she lusted after them and sent messengers to them in Chaldea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Babylonians came to her to the bed of love and defiled her with their obscene practice. And when she had been defiled by them, she turned away from them in disgust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She exposed her obscene practices and exposed her nakedness; then I turned away from her in disgust, just as I had turned away from her sister in disgust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet she multiplied her obscene practices, remembering the days of her youth, when she prostituted herself in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She lusted after their lovers, whose flesh is like the flesh of donkeys and whose discharge is like the discharge of horses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you longed for the outrageous sin of your youth, when the Egyptians handled your breasts because of the breasts of your youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, Oholibah, this is what the Lord God says: ‘Behold I am going to incite your lovers against you, from whom you turned away in disgust, and I will bring them against you from every side:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Babylonians and all the Chaldeans, Pekod and Shoa and Koa, and all the Assyrians with them; handsome young men, governors and officials all of them, officers and men of renown, all of them riding on horses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they will come against you with weapons, chariots, and wagons, and with a contingent of peoples. They will attack you on every side with shield, buckler, and helmet; and I will commit the judgment to them, and they will judge you according to their customs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will set My jealousy against you, so that they may deal with you in wrath. They will remove your nose and your ears; and your survivors will fall by the sword. They will take your sons and your daughters; and your survivors will be consumed by the fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will also strip you of your clothes and take away your beautiful jewelry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will remove from you your outrageous sin and your prostitution that you brought from the land of Egypt, so that you will not raise your eyes to them or remember Egypt anymore.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is what the Lord God says: ‘Behold, I am going to hand you over to those whom you hate, to those from whom you turned away in disgust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will deal with you in hatred, take all your property, and leave you naked and bare. And the nakedness of your prostitution will be exposed, both your outrageous sin and your obscene practices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things will be done to you because you have adulterously pursued the nations, because you have defiled yourself with their idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have walked in the way of your sister; therefore I will put her cup in your hand.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord God says:
‘You will drink your sister’s cup,
Which is deep and wide.
You will be laughed at and held in derision;
Because it contains much.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will be filled with drunkenness and grief,
A cup of horror and desolation,
The cup of your sister Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And you will drink it and drain it.
Then you will gnaw on its fragments
And tear your breasts;
for I have spoken,’ declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, this is what the Lord God says: ‘Because you have forgotten Me and discarded Me behind your back, suffer on your own part the punishment for your outrageous sin and your obscene practices.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, the Lord said to me, “Son of man, will you judge Oholah and Oholibah? Then declare to them their abominations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they have committed adultery, and blood is on their hands. So they have committed adultery with their idols, and even made their sons, whom they bore to Me, pass through the fire to them as food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, they have done this to Me: they have defiled My sanctuary on the same day, and have profaned My Sabbaths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when they slaughtered their children for their idols, they entered My sanctuary on the same day to profane it; and behold, this is what they did within My house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Furthermore, they have even sent for men who come from a great distance, to whom a messenger was sent; and behold, they came—for whom you bathed, put makeup on your eyes, and adorned yourselves with jewelry;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you sat on a splendid couch with a table arranged in front of it on which you had set My incense and My oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the sound of a carefree multitude was with her; and heavy drinkers were brought from the wilderness with people from the multitude of humanity. And they put bracelets on the wrists of the women and beautiful crowns on their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then I said concerning her who was worn out by adulteries, ‘Will they now commit adultery with her when she is like this?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they went in to her as they would go in to a prostitute. This is how they went in to Oholah and to Oholibah, the lewd women.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they, righteous people, will judge them with the judgment of adulteresses and with the judgment of women who shed blood, because they are adulteresses and blood is on their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For this is what the Lord God says: ‘Bring up a contingent against them and turn them over to terror and plunder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The contingent will stone them with stones and cut them down with their swords; they will kill their sons and their daughters and burn their houses with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will eliminate outrageous conduct from the land, so that all women will take warning and not commit outrageous sin as you have done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your outrageous conduct will be repaid to you, and you will bear the guilt for your idols; so you will know that I am the Lord God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the word of the Lord came to me in the ninth year, in the tenth month, on the tenth of the month, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, write the name of the day, this very day. The king of Babylon has laid siege to Jerusalem this very day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Present a parable to the rebellious house and say to them, ‘This is what the Lord God says:
“Put on the pot, put it on and also pour water into it;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Take the choicest of the flock,
And also stack wood under the pot.
Make it boil vigorously.
Also boil its bones in it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Therefore, this is what the Lord God says:
“Woe to the bloody city,
To the pot in which there is rust
And whose rust has not gone out of it!
Take out of it piece after piece,
Without making a choice.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
So that it may cause wrath to come up to take vengeance,
I have put her blood on the bare rock,
So that it will not be covered.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, this is what the Lord God says:
“Woe to the bloody city!
I also will make the wood pile great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Heap on the wood, kindle the fire,
Cook the meat thoroughly
And mix in the spices,
And let the bones be burned up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then set it empty on its burning coals
So that it may be hot
And its bronze may glow,
And its filthiness may be melted in it,
Its rust eliminated.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
In your filthiness is outrageous sin.
Because I would have cleansed you,
Yet you are not clean,
You will not be cleansed from your filthiness again
Until I have expended My wrath on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, the Lord, have spoken; it is coming and I will act. I will not overlook, I will not pity, and I will not be sorry; according to your ways and according to your deeds I will judge you,” declares the Lord God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, behold, I am about to take from you what is precious to your eyes with a fatal blow; but you shall not mourn and you shall not weep, and your tears shall not come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Groan silently; do no mourning for the dead. Bind on your turban and put your sandals on your feet, and do not cover your mustache, and do not eat the bread of other people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I spoke to the people in the morning, and in the evening my wife died. And in the morning I did as I was commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people said to me, “Will you not tell us what these things mean for us, that you are doing?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said to them, “The word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Speak to the house of Israel, “This is what the Lord God says: ‘Behold, I am about to profane My sanctuary, the pride of your power, that which is precious in your eyes and the longing of your soul; and your sons and your daughters whom you have left behind will fall by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will do just as I have done; you will not cover your mustache, and you will not eat the bread of other people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your turbans will be on your heads, and your sandals on your feet. You will not mourn and you will not weep; but you will rot away in your guilty deeds, and you will groan to one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Ezekiel will be a sign to you; according to all that he has done, you will do. When it comes, then you will know that I am the Lord God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘As for you, son of man, will it not be on the day when I take from them their stronghold, the joy of their splendor, that which is precious in their eyes and their heart’s longing, their sons and their daughters,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that on that day the one who escapes will come to you with information for your ears?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day your mouth will be opened to him who escaped, and you will speak and no longer be silenced. So you will be a sign to them, and they will know that I am the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, set your face against the sons of Ammon and prophesy against them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say to the sons of Ammon, ‘Hear the word of the Lord God! This is what the Lord God says: “Because you said, ‘Aha!’ against My sanctuary when it was profaned, and against the land of Israel when it was made desolate, and against the house of Judah when they went into exile,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, behold, I am going to give you to the people of the east as a possession, and they will set up their encampments among you and make their dwellings among you; they will eat your fruit and drink your milk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make Rabbah a pasture for camels, and the sons of Ammon a resting place for flocks. Then you will know that I am the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is what the Lord God says: “Because you have clapped your hands and stamped your feet, and have rejoiced with all the malice in your soul against the land of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, behold, I have reached out with My hand against you and I will give you as plunder to the nations. And I will cut you off from the peoples and eliminate you from the lands. I will exterminate you. So you will know that I am the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘The Lord God says this: “Because Moab and Seir say, ‘Behold, the house of Judah is like all the nations,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, behold, I am going to deprive the flank of Moab of its cities, of its cities which are on its frontiers, the glory of the land, Beth-jeshimoth, Baal-meon, and Kiriathaim;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I will give it as a possession along with the sons of Ammon to the people of the east, so that the sons of Ammon will not be remembered among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will execute judgments on Moab, and they will know that I am the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘The Lord God says this: “Because Edom has acted against the house of Judah by taking vengeance, and has incurred great guilt, and avenged themselves upon them,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore this is what the Lord God says: “I will also reach out with My hand against Edom and eliminate human and animal life from it. And I will turn it into ruins; from Teman even to Dedan they will fall by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will inflict My vengeance on Edom by the hand of My people Israel. Therefore, they will act in Edom in accordance with My anger and My wrath; so they will know My vengeance,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord God says: “Because the Philistines have acted in revenge, and have taken vengeance with malice in their souls to destroy with everlasting hostility,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore this is what the Lord God says: “Behold, I am going to reach out with My hand against the Philistines and eliminate the Cherethites; and I will destroy the remnant of the seacoast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will execute great vengeance on them with wrathful rebukes; and they will know that I am the Lord, when I inflict My vengeance on them.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the eleventh year, on the first of the month, the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, because Tyre has said in regard to Jerusalem, ‘Aha! The gateway of the peoples is broken; it has opened to me. I shall be filled, now that she is laid waste,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore this is what the Lord God says: ‘Behold, I am against you, Tyre, and I will bring up many nations against you, as the sea brings up its waves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will destroy the walls of Tyre and tear down her towers; and I will sweep her debris away from her and make her a bare rock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She will become a dry place for the spreading of nets in the midst of the sea, for I have spoken,’ declares the Lord God; ‘and she will become plunder for the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also her daughters who are on the mainland will be killed by the sword, and they will know that I am the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord God says this: “Behold, I am going to bring upon Tyre from the north Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, king of kings, with horses, chariots, cavalry, and a great army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will kill your daughters on the mainland with the sword; and he will make siege walls against you, pile up an assault ramp against you, and raise up a large shield against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he will direct the blow of his battering rams against your walls, and he will tear down your towers with his axes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because of the multitude of his horses, the dust raised by them will cover you; your walls will shake from the noise of cavalry, wagons, and chariots when he enters your gates as warriors enter a city that is breached.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With the hoofs of his horses he will trample all your streets. He will kill your people with the sword, and your strong pillars will go down to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also they will take your riches as spoils and plunder your merchandise, tear down your walls and destroy your delightful houses, and throw your stones, your timbers, and your debris into the water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will put an end to the sound of your songs, and the sound of your harps will no longer be heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will turn you into a bare rock; you will become a dry place for the spreading of nets. You will not be rebuilt, for I the Lord have spoken,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord God says this to Tyre: “Will the coastlands not shake from the sound of your downfall when the wounded groan, when the slaughter takes place in your midst?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the princes of the sea will descend from their thrones, remove their robes, and strip off their colorfully woven garments. They will clothe themselves with trembling; they will sit on the ground, tremble again and again, and be appalled at you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they will take up a song of mourning over you and say to you,
‘How you have perished, you inhabited one,
From the seas, you famous city,
Which was mighty on the sea,
She and her inhabitants,
Who imposed her terror
On all her inhabitants!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now the coastlands will tremble
On the day of your downfall;
Yes, the coastlands which are by the sea
Will be horrified at your passing.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is what the Lord God says: “When I make you a desolate city, like the cities which are not inhabited, when I bring up the deep over you and the great waters cover you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will bring you down with those who go down to the pit, to the people of old, and I will make you remain in the lower parts of the earth, like the ancient ruins, with those who go down to the pit, so that you will not be inhabited; but I will put glory in the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will cause you sudden terrors and you will no longer exist; though you will be sought, you will never be found again,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you, son of man, take up a song of mourning over Tyre;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and say to Tyre, who sits at the entrance to the sea, merchant of the peoples to many coastlands, ‘This is what the Lord God says:
“Tyre, you have said, ‘I am perfect in beauty.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your borders are in the heart of the seas;
Your builders have perfected your beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They have made all your planks of juniper trees from Senir;
They have taken a cedar from Lebanon to make a mast for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of oaks from Bashan they have made your rudders;
With ivory they have inlaid your deck of boxwood from the coastlands of Cyprus.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The inhabitants of Sidon and Arvad were your rowers;
Your wise men, Tyre, were aboard; they were your sailors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The elders of Gebal and her wise men were with you repairing your leaks;
All the ships of the sea and their sailors were with you in order to deal in your merchandise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Persia, Lud, and Put were in your army, your men of war. They hung up shield and helmet on you; they presented your splendor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Arvad and your army were on your walls, all around, and the Gammadim were in your towers. They hung their shields on your walls all around; they perfected your beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tarshish was your customer because of the abundance of all kinds of wealth; with silver, iron, tin, and lead they paid for your merchandise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Javan, Tubal, and Meshech, they were your traders; with human lives and vessels of bronze they paid for your merchandise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those from Beth-togarmah gave horses, war horses, and mules for your merchandise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Dedan were your traders. Many coastlands were your market; they brought ivory tusks and ebony as your payment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aram was your customer because of the abundance of your goods; they paid for your merchandise with emeralds, purple, colorfully woven cloth, fine linen, coral, and rubies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah and the land of Israel, they were your traders; with the wheat of Minnith, cakes, honey, oil, and balsam they paid for your merchandise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Damascus was your customer because of the abundance of your goods, because of the abundance of all kinds of wealth, because of the wine of Helbon and white wool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Vedan and Javan paid for your merchandise from Uzal; wrought iron, cassia, and spice reed were among your merchandise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dedan traded with you in saddlecloths for riding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arabia and all the princes of Kedar, they were your customers for lambs, rams, and goats; for these they were your customers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The traders of Sheba and Raamah, they traded with you; they paid for your merchandise with the best of all balsam oil, and with all kinds of precious stones, and gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Haran, Canneh, Eden, the traders of Sheba, Asshur, and Chilmad traded with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They traded with you in choice garments, in clothes of violet and colorfully woven cloth, and in blankets of two colors, and tightly wound cords, which were among your merchandise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The ships of Tarshish were the carriers for your merchandise.
And you were filled and were very glorious
In the heart of the seas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Your rowers have brought you
Into great waters;
The east wind has broken you
In the heart of the seas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your wealth, your wares, your merchandise,
Your seamen and your sailors,
Your repairers of leaks, your dealers in merchandise,
And all your men of war who are in you,
With all your contingent that is in your midst,
Will fall into the heart of the seas
On the day of your overthrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At the sound of the cry of your sailors,
The pasture lands will shake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All who handle the oar,
The seamen and all the sailors of the sea
Will come down from their ships;
They will stand on the land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they will make their voice heard over you
And cry out bitterly.
They will throw dust on their heads,
They will wallow in ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also they will shave themselves bald for you
And put on sackcloth;
And they will weep for you in bitterness of soul
With bitter mourning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moreover, in their wailing they will take up a song of mourning for you
And sing a song of mourning over you:
‘Who is like Tyre,
Like her who is silent in the midst of the sea?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When your merchandise went out from the seas,
You satisfied many peoples;
With the abundance of your wealth and your merchandise
You enriched the kings of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now that you are broken by the seas
In the depths of the waters,
Your merchandise and all your company
Have fallen in the midst of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the inhabitants of the coastlands
Are appalled at you,
And their kings are horribly afraid;
They have a troubled look.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came again to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Son of man, say to the leader of Tyre, ‘The Lord God says this:
“Because your heart is haughty
And you have said, ‘I am a god,
I sit in the seat of gods
In the heart of the seas’;
Yet you are a mortal and not God,
Although you make your heart like the heart of God—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, you are wiser than Daniel;
There is no secret that is a match for you!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By your wisdom and understanding
You have acquired riches for yourself
And have acquired gold and silver for your treasuries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By your great wisdom, by your trade
You have increased your riches,
And your heart is haughty because of your riches—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore this is what the Lord God says:
‘Because you have made your heart
Like the heart of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore, behold, I am going to bring strangers against you,
The most ruthless of the nations.
And they will draw their swords
Against the beauty of your wisdom
And profane your splendor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will bring you down to the pit,
And you will die the death of those who are killed
In the heart of the seas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will you still say, “I am a god,”
In the presence of one who kills you,
Though you are a mortal and not God,
In the hands of those who wound you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will die the death of the uncircumcised
By the hand of strangers,
For I have spoken!’ declares the Lord God!”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Son of man, take up a song of mourning over the king of Tyre and say to him, ‘This is what the Lord God says:
“You had the seal of perfection,
Full of wisdom and perfect in beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You were the anointed cherub who covers,
And I placed you there.
You were on the holy mountain of God;
You walked in the midst of the stones of fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You were blameless in your ways
From the day you were created
Until unrighteousness was found in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the abundance of your trade
You were internally filled with violence,
And you sinned;
Therefore I have cast you as profane
From the mountain of God.
And I have destroyed you, you covering cherub,
From the midst of the stones of fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
By the multitude of your wrongdoings,
In the unrighteousness of your trade
You profaned your sanctuaries.
Therefore I have brought fire from the midst of you;
It has consumed you,
And I have turned you to ashes on the earth
In the eyes of all who see you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All who know you among the peoples
Are appalled at you;
You have become terrified
And you will cease to be forever.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, set your face toward Sidon, prophesy against her
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and say, ‘This is what the Lord God says:
“Behold, I am against you, Sidon,
And I will appear in My glory in your midst.
Then they will know that I am the Lord, when I execute judgments against her,
And I will reveal Myself as holy in her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I will send a plague to her
And blood to her streets,
And the wounded will fall in her midst
By the sword upon her on every side;
Then they will know that I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there will no longer be for the house of Israel a painful thorn or a hurtful thorn bush from any surrounding them who despised them; then they will know that I am the Lord God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord God says: “When I gather the house of Israel from the peoples among whom they are scattered, and show Myself holy among them in the sight of the nations, then they will live on their land which I gave to My servant Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will live on it securely; and they will build houses, plant vineyards, and live securely when I execute judgments upon all around them who despise them. Then they will know that I am the Lord their God.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the tenth year, in the tenth month, on the twelfth of the month, the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, set your face against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and prophesy against him and against all Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Speak and say, ‘This is what the Lord God says:
“Behold, I am against you, Pharaoh king of Egypt,
The great monster that lies in the midst of his canals,
That has said, ‘My Nile is mine, and I myself have made it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will put hooks in your jaws
And make the fish of your canals cling to your scales.
And I will bring you up out of the midst of your canals,
And all the fish of your canals will cling to your scales.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Then all the inhabitants of Egypt will know that I am the Lord,
Because they have been only a staff made of reed to the house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When they took hold of you with the hand,
You broke and tore all their hands;
And when they leaned on you,
You broke and made all their hips shake.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Therefore the Lord God says this: “Behold, I am going to bring upon you a sword, and I will cut off from you human and animal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The land of Egypt will become a desolation and place of ruins. Then they will know that I am the Lord.
“Because you said, ‘The Nile is mine, and I have made it,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, behold, I am against you and against your canals, and I will make the land of Egypt an utter waste and desolation, from Migdol to Syene and as far as the border of Cush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A human foot will not pass through it, nor will the foot of an animal pass through it, and it will not be inhabited for forty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will make the land of Egypt a desolation in the midst of deserted lands. And her cities, in the midst of cities that are laid waste, will be desolate for forty years; and I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them among the lands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘For this is what the Lord God says: “At the end of forty years I will gather the Egyptians from the peoples among whom they were scattered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will restore the fortunes of Egypt and bring them back to the land of Pathros, to the land of their origin, and there they will be a lowly kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be the lowest of the kingdoms, and it will not raise itself above the nations again. And I will make them small so that they will not rule over the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it will no longer be a kingdom on which the house of Israel relies, bringing to mind the guilt of their having turned to Egypt. Then they will know that I am the Lord God.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the twenty-seventh year, in the first month, on the first of the month, the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon made his army labor hard against Tyre; every head had a bald spot and every shoulder was rubbed raw. But he and his army acquired no wages from Tyre for the labor that he had performed against it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore this is what the Lord God says: “Behold, I am going to give the land of Egypt to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon. And he will carry off her wealth and capture her spoils and seize her plunder; and it will be wages for his army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have given him the land of Egypt for his labor which he performed, because they acted for Me,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On that day I will make a horn sprout for the house of Israel, and I will open your mouth among them. Then they will know that I am the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came again to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Son of man, prophesy and say, ‘This is what the Lord God says:
“Wail, ‘Woe for the day!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the day is near,
Indeed, the day of the Lord is near;
It will be a day of clouds,
A time of doom for the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A sword will come upon Egypt,
And there will be trembling in Cush;
When the slain fall in Egypt,
They will take away her wealth,
And her foundations will be torn down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cush, Put, Lud, all Arabia, Libya and the people of the land that is in league will fall with them by the sword.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘This is what the Lord says:
“Indeed, those who support Egypt will fall
And the pride of her power will come down;
From Migdol to Syene
They will fall within her by the sword,”
Declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They will be desolate
In the midst of the desolated lands;
And her cities will be
In the midst of the devastated cities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they will know that I am the Lord,
When I set a fire in Egypt
And all her helpers are broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day messengers will go out from Me in ships to frighten carefree Cush; and trembling will come on them as on the day of Egypt; for behold, it is coming!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘This is what the Lord God says:
“I will also make the hordes of Egypt cease
By the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He and his people with him,
The most ruthless of the nations,
Will be brought in to destroy the land;
And they will draw their swords against Egypt
And fill the land with the slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Moreover, I will make the Nile canals dry
And sell the land into the hands of evil men.
And I will make the land desolate
And all that is in it,
By the hand of strangers; I the Lord have spoken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘This is what the Lord God says:
“I will also destroy the idols
And make the images cease from Memphis.
And there will no longer be a prince in the land of Egypt;
And I will put fear in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will make Pathros desolate,
Set a fire in Zoan
And execute judgments on Thebes.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will set a fire in Egypt;
Sin will writhe in anguish,
Thebes will be breached
And Memphis will have distresses daily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The young men of On and of Pi-beseth
Will fall by the sword,
And the women will go into captivity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In Tehaphnehes the day will be dark
When I break there the yoke bars of Egypt.
Then the pride of her power will cease in her;
A cloud will cover her,
And her daughters will go into captivity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I will execute judgments on Egypt,
And they will know that I am the Lord.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the eleventh year, in the first month, on the seventh of the month, the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt; and, behold, it has not been bound up for healing or wrapped with a bandage, so that it may be strong to wield the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore this is what the Lord God says: ‘Behold, I am against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and I will break his arms, both the strong and the broken; and I will make the sword fall from his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them among the lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon and put My sword in his hand; and I will break the arms of Pharaoh, so that he will groan before him with the groans of a wounded man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, but the arms of Pharaoh will fail. Then they will know that I am the Lord, when I put My sword into the hand of the king of Babylon and he reaches out with it against the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them among the lands, then they will know that I am the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the eleventh year, in the third month, on the first of the month, the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Son of man, say to Pharaoh king of Egypt and to his hordes,
‘Whom are you like in your greatness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, Assyria was a cedar in Lebanon
With beautiful branches and forest shade,
And very high,
And its top was among the clouds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The waters made it grow, the deep made it high.
With its rivers it continually extended all around its planting place,
And sent out its channels to all the trees of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore its height was loftier than all the trees of the field
And its boughs became many and its branches long
Because of many waters as it spread them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the birds of the sky nested in its twigs,
And under its branches all the animals of the field gave birth,
And all great nations lived under its shade.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So it was beautiful in its greatness, in the length of its branches;
For its roots extended to many waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The cedars in God’s garden could not match it;
The junipers could not compare with its branches,
And the plane trees could not match its branches.
No tree in God’s garden could compare with it in its beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I made it beautiful with the multitude of its branches,
And all the trees of Eden, which were in the garden of God, were jealous of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Therefore this is what the Lord God says: “Because it is tall in stature and has put its top among the clouds, and its heart is haughty in its loftiness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will hand it over to a ruler of the nations; he will thoroughly deal with it. In accordance with its wickedness I have driven it out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Foreign tyrants of the nations have cut it down and left it; on the mountains and in all the valleys its branches have fallen, and its branches have been broken in all the ravines of the land. And all the peoples of the earth have gone down from its shade and left it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the birds of the sky will nest on its fallen trunk, and all the animals of the field will rest on its fallen branches,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that all the trees by the waters will not be exalted in their stature, nor put their tops among the clouds, nor will any of their well-watered mighty ones stand straight in their height. For they have all been turned over to death, to the earth beneath, among mankind, with those who go down to the pit.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord God says: “On the day when it went down to Sheol I caused mourning; I closed the deep over it and held back its rivers. And its many waters were stopped up, and I made Lebanon mourn for it, and all the trees of the field wilted away on account of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I made the nations quake from the sound of its fall when I made it go down to Sheol with those who go down to the pit; and all the well-watered trees of Eden, the choicest and best of Lebanon, were comforted in the earth beneath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also went down with it to Sheol to those who were slain by the sword; and those who were its strength lived in its shade among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “To which among the trees of Eden are you so alike in glory and greatness? Yet you will be brought down with the trees of Eden to the earth beneath; you will lie in the midst of the uncircumcised with those who were killed by the sword. This is Pharaoh and all his hordes!”’ declares the Lord God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the twelfth year, in the twelfth month, on the first of the month, the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Son of man, take up a song of mourning over Pharaoh king of Egypt, and say to him,
‘You compared yourself to a young lion of the nations,
Yet you are like the monster in the seas;
And you burst forth in your rivers
And muddied the waters with your feet
And fouled their rivers.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is what the Lord God says:
“Now I will spread My net over you
With a contingent of many peoples,
And they will lift you up in My net.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will leave you on the land;
I will hurl you on the open field.
And I will cause all the birds of the sky to nest on you,
And I will satisfy the animals of the whole earth with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will lay your flesh on the mountains
And fill the valleys with your refuse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will also make the land drink the discharge of your blood
As far as the mountains,
And the ravines will be full of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And when I extinguish you,
I will cover the heavens and darken their stars;
I will cover the sun with a cloud
And the moon will not give its light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the shining lights in the heavens
I will darken over you
And will set darkness on your land,”
Declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will also trouble the hearts of many peoples when I bring your destruction among the nations, into lands which you have not known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will make many peoples appalled at you, and their kings will be horribly afraid of you when I brandish My sword before them; and they will tremble again and again, every person for his own life, on the day of your fall.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord God says this: “The sword of the king of Babylon will attack you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the swords of the warriors I will make your multitude fall; all of them are tyrants of the nations,
And they will devastate the pride of Egypt,
And all its multitude will be destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Then I will make their waters settle,
And make their rivers run like oil,”
Declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“When I make the land of Egypt a desolation,
And the land is destitute of that which filled it,
When I strike all those who live in it,
Then they shall know that I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is a song of mourning, and they shall sing it. The daughters of the nations shall sing it. Over Egypt and over all her hordes they shall sing it,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the twelfth year, on the fifteenth of the month, the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, lament for the hordes of Egypt and bring it down, her and the daughters of the mighty nations, to the netherworld, with those who go down to the pit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Whom do you surpass in beauty?
Go down and make your bed with the uncircumcised.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall fall in the midst of those who are killed by the sword. She is turned over to the sword; they have dragged her and all her hordes away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The strong among the mighty ones shall speak of him and his helpers from the midst of Sheol: ‘They have gone down, they lie still, the uncircumcised, killed by the sword.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Assyria is there and all her company; her graves are all around her. All of them killed, fallen by the sword,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whose graves are set in the remotest parts of the pit, and her company is all around her grave. All of them killed, fallen by the sword, who spread terror in the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Elam is there and all her hordes around her grave; all of them killed, fallen by the sword, who went down uncircumcised to the lower parts of the earth, who inflicted their terror on the land of the living, and bore their disgrace with those who go down to the pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have made a bed for her among the slain with all her hordes. Her graves are around it, they are all uncircumcised, killed by the sword (although their terror was inflicted on the land of the living), and they bore their disgrace with those who go down to the pit; they were put in the midst of the slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Meshech, Tubal, and all their hordes are there; their graves surround them. All of them were killed by the sword uncircumcised, though they inflicted their terror on the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nor do they lie beside the fallen heroes of the uncircumcised, who went down to Sheol with their weapons of war and whose swords were placed under their heads; but the punishment for their wrongdoing rested on their bones, though the terror of these heroes was once in the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in the midst of the uncircumcised you will be broken and lie with those killed by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There also is Edom, its kings and all its princes, who despite all their might are laid with those killed by the sword; they will lie with the uncircumcised and with those who go down to the pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There also are the chiefs of the north, all of them, and all the Sidonians, who in spite of the terror resulting from their might, in shame went down with the slain. So they lay down uncircumcised with those killed by the sword and bore their disgrace with those who go down to the pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “These Pharaoh will see, and he will find consolation regarding all his hordes killed by the sword, Pharaoh and all his army,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Though I inflicted the terror of him on the land of the living, yet he will be laid to rest among the uncircumcised along with those killed by the sword, Pharaoh and all his hordes,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, speak to the sons of your people and say to them, ‘If I bring a sword upon a land, and the people of the land take one man from among them and make him their watchman,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he sees the sword coming upon the land and blows the horn and warns the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then someone who hears the sound of the horn but does not take warning, and a sword comes and takes him away, his blood will be on his own head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He heard the sound of the horn but did not take warning; his blood will be on himself. But had he taken warning, he would have saved his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the watchman sees the sword coming and does not blow the horn and the people are not warned, and a sword comes and takes a person from them, he is taken away for his wrongdoing; but I will require his blood from the watchman’s hand.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now as for you, son of man, I have appointed you as a watchman for the house of Israel; so you will hear a message from My mouth and give them a warning from Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I say to the wicked, ‘You wicked person, you will certainly die,’ and you do not speak to warn the wicked about his way, that wicked person shall die for his wrongdoing, but I will require his blood from your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you on your part warn a wicked person to turn from his way and he does not turn from his way, he will die for his wrongdoing, but you have saved your life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now as for you, son of man, say to the house of Israel, ‘This is what you have said: “Surely our offenses and our sins are upon us, and we are rotting away in them; how then can we survive?”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to them, ‘As I live!’ declares the Lord God, ‘I take no pleasure at all in the death of the wicked, but rather that the wicked turn from his way and live. Turn back, turn back from your evil ways! Why then should you die, house of Israel?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, son of man, say to your fellow citizens, ‘The righteousness of a righteous one will not save him on the day of his offense, and as for the wickedness of a wicked one, he will not stumble because of it on the day when he turns from his wickedness; whereas a righteous one will not be able to live by his righteousness on the day when he commits sin.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I say to the righteous that he will certainly live, and he so trusts in his righteousness that he commits injustice, none of his righteous deeds will be remembered; but for that same injustice of his which he has committed he will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when I say to the wicked, ‘You will certainly die,’ and he turns from his sin and practices justice and righteousness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if a wicked person returns a pledge, pays back what he has taken by robbery, walks by the statutes which ensure life without committing injustice, he shall certainly live; he shall not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None of his sins that he has committed will be remembered against him. He has practiced justice and righteousness; he shall certainly live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yet your fellow citizens say, ‘The way of the Lord is not right,’ when it is their own way that is not right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the righteous turns from his righteousness and commits injustice, then he shall die in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the wicked turns from his wickedness and practices justice and righteousness, he will live by them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet you say, ‘The way of the Lord is not right.’ I will judge each of you according to his ways, house of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the twelfth year of our exile, on the fifth of the tenth month, the survivor from Jerusalem came to me, saying, “The city has been taken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
