verses.text: Now the hand of the Lord had been upon me in the evening, before the survivors came. And He opened my mouth at the time they came to me in the morning; so my mouth was opened and I was no longer speechless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, they who live in these ruins in the land of Israel are saying, ‘Abraham was only one, yet he possessed the land; so to us who are many the land has been given as a possession.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore say to them, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “You eat meat with the blood in it, raise your eyes to your idols as you shed blood. Should you then possess the land?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You rely on your sword, you commit abominations, and each of you defiles his neighbor’s wife. Should you then possess the land?”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall say this to them: ‘This is what the Lord God says: “As I live, those who are in the places of ruins certainly will fall by the sword, and whoever is in the open field I will give to the animals to be devoured, and those who are in the strongholds and in the caves will die of plague.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will make the land a desolation and a waste, and the pride of her power will be brought to an end; and the mountains of Israel will be deserted so that no one will pass through.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will know that I am the Lord, when I make the land a desolation and a waste because of all their abominations which they have committed.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But as for you, son of man, your fellow citizens who talk with one another about you by the walls and in the doorways of the houses, speak one with another, each with his brother, saying, ‘Come now and hear what the message is that comes from the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they come to you as people come, and sit before you as My people and hear your words, but they do not do them; for they do the lustful desires expressed by their mouth, and their heart follows their unlawful gain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, you are to them like a love song by one who has a beautiful voice and plays well on an instrument; for they hear your words but they do not practice them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when it comes—as it certainly will—then they will know that a prophet has been among them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, prophesy against the shepherds of Israel. Prophesy and say to those shepherds, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “Woe, shepherds of Israel who have been feeding themselves! Should the shepherds not feed the flock?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You eat the fat and clothe yourselves with the wool, you slaughter the fat sheep without feeding the flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who are sickly you have not strengthened, the diseased you have not healed, the broken you have not bound up, the scattered you have not brought back, nor have you searched for the lost; but with force and with violence you have dominated them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They scattered for lack of a shepherd, and they became food for every animal of the field and scattered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My flock strayed through all the mountains and on every high hill; My flock was scattered over all the surface of the earth, and there was no one to search or seek for them.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, you shepherds, hear the word of the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As I live,” declares the Lord God, “certainly, because My flock has become plunder, and My flock has become food for all the animals of the field for lack of a shepherd, and My shepherds did not search for My flock, but rather the shepherds fed themselves and did not feed My flock,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, you shepherds, hear the word of the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord God says: “Behold, I am against the shepherds, and I will demand My sheep from them and make them stop tending sheep. So the shepherds will not feed themselves anymore, but I will save My sheep from their mouth, so that they will not be food for them.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord God says this: “Behold, I Myself will search for My sheep and look after them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a shepherd cares for his flock on a day when he is among his scattered sheep, so I will care for My sheep and will rescue them from all the places where they were scattered on a cloudy and gloomy day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring them out from the peoples and gather them from the countries and bring them to their own land; and I will feed them on the mountains of Israel, by the streams, and in all the inhabited places of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will feed them in a good pasture, and their grazing place will be on the mountain heights of Israel. There they will lie down in a good grazing place and feed in rich pasture on the mountains of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I Myself will feed My flock and I Myself will lead them to rest,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will seek the lost, bring back the scattered, bind up the broken, and strengthen the sick; but the fat and the strong I will eliminate. I will feed them with judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for you, My flock, this is what the Lord God says: ‘Behold, I am going to judge between one sheep and another, between the rams and the male goats.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is it too little a thing for you to feed in the good pasture, that you must trample with your feet the rest of your pastures? Or too little for you to drink the clear waters, that you must muddy the rest with your feet?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for My flock, they must eat what you trample with your feet, and drink what you muddy with your feet!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, this is what the Lord God says to them: “Behold, I, I Myself will also judge between the fat sheep and the lean sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since you push away with your side and shoulder, and gore all the weak with your horns until you have scattered them abroad,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, I will save My flock, and they will no longer be plunder; and I will judge between one sheep and another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then I will appoint over them one shepherd, My servant David, and he will feed them; he will feed them himself and be their shepherd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I, the Lord, will be their God, and My servant David will be prince among them; I the Lord have spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And I will make a covenant of peace with them and eliminate harmful animals from the land, so that they may live securely in the wilderness and sleep in the woods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make them and the places around My hill a blessing. And I will make showers fall in their season; they will be showers of blessing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also the tree of the field will yield its fruit and the earth will yield its produce, and they will be secure on their land. Then they will know that I am the Lord, when I have broken the bars of their yoke and have saved them from the hand of those who enslaved them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will no longer be plunder to the nations, and the animals of the earth will not devour them; but they will live securely, and no one will make them afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will establish for them a renowned planting place, and they will not again be victims of famine in the land, and they will not endure the insults of the nations anymore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will know that I, the Lord their God, am with them, and that they, the house of Israel, are My people,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for you, My sheep, the sheep of My pasture, you are mankind, and I am your God,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, set your face against Mount Seir, and prophesy against it
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and say to it, ‘This is what the Lord God says:
“Behold, I am against you, Mount Seir,
And I will reach out with My hand against you
And make you a desolation and a waste.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will turn your cities to ruins,
And you will become a desolation.
Then you will know that I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since you have had everlasting hostility and have turned over the sons of Israel to the power of the sword at the time of their disaster, at the time of the punishment of the end,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore as I live,” declares the Lord God, “I will certainly doom you to bloodshed, and bloodshed will pursue you; since you have not hated bloodshed, therefore bloodshed will pursue you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make Mount Seir a waste and a desolation and I will eliminate from it one who passes through and returns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will fill its mountains with its slain; those killed by the sword will fall on your hills, in your valleys, and in all your ravines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make you a permanent desolation, and your cities will not be inhabited. Then you will know that I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Since you have said, ‘These two nations and these two lands will be mine, and we will possess them,’ although the Lord was there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore as I live,” declares the Lord God, “I will deal with you according to your anger and according to your envy which you displayed because of your hatred for them; so I will make Myself known among them when I judge you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will know that I, the Lord, have heard all your insults which you have spoken against the mountains of Israel saying, ‘They are desolate; they have been given to us as food.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you have spoken arrogantly against Me and have multiplied your words against Me; I Myself have heard it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord God says: “As all the earth rejoices, I will make you a desolation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As you rejoiced over the inheritance of the house of Israel because it was desolate, so I will do to you. You will be a desolation, Mount Seir, and all Edom, all of it. Then they will know that I am the Lord.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now you, son of man, prophesy to the mountains of Israel and say, ‘You mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord God says: “Since the enemy has spoken against you, ‘Aha!’ and, ‘The everlasting heights have become our possession,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore prophesy and say, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “For good reason they have made you desolate and harassed you from every side, so that you would become a possession of the rest of the nations; and you have been taken up in the talk and the rumor of the people.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, you mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord God. This is what the Lord God says to the mountains and to the hills, to the ravines and to the valleys, to the desolate ruins and to the abandoned cities which have become plunder and an object of ridicule to the rest of the nations which are all around—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore the Lord God says this: “Certainly in the fire of My jealousy I have spoken against the rest of the nations, and against all Edom, who appropriated My land for themselves as a possession with wholehearted joy and with contempt of soul, in order to make its pastureland plunder.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore prophesy in regard to the land of Israel and say to the mountains and to the hills, to the ravines and to the valleys, “This is what the Lord God says: ‘Behold, I have spoken in My jealousy and in My wrath because you have endured the insults of the nations.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the Lord God says this: ‘I have sworn that the nations that are around you will certainly endure their insults themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for you, mountains of Israel, you will grow your branches and bear fruit for My people Israel; for they are about to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For, behold, I am for you, and I will turn to you, and you will be cultivated and sown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will multiply people on you, all the house of Israel, all of it; and the cities will be inhabited and the ruins will be rebuilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will multiply on you people and animals, and they will increase and be fruitful; and I will populate you as you were previously, and treat you better than at the beginning. Then you will know that I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, I will have people—My people Israel—walk on you and possess you, so that you will become their inheritance and never again bereave them of children.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Lord God says this: ‘Since they say to you, “You are a devourer of people and have bereaved your nation of children,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for that reason you will no longer devour people and no longer bereave your nation of children,’ declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will not let you hear insults from the nations anymore, nor will you suffer disgrace from the peoples any longer, nor will you make your nation stumble any longer,” declares the Lord God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, when the house of Israel was living on their own land, they defiled it by their ways and their deeds; their way before Me was like the uncleanness of a woman in her impurity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I poured out My wrath on them for the blood which they had shed on the land, because they had defiled it with their idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also scattered them among the nations, and they were dispersed throughout the lands. According to their ways and their deeds I judged them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came to the nations where they went, they profaned My holy name, because it was said of them, ‘These are the people of the Lord, yet they have left His land.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I had concern for My holy name, which the house of Israel had profaned among the nations where they went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore say to the house of Israel, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “It is not for your sake, house of Israel, that I am about to act, but for My holy name, which you have profaned among the nations where you went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will vindicate the holiness of My great name which has been profaned among the nations, which you have profaned among them. Then the nations will know that I am the Lord,” declares the Lord God, “when I show Myself holy among you in their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I will take you from the nations, and gather you from all the lands; and I will bring you into your own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will sprinkle clean water on you, and you will be clean; I will cleanse you from all your filthiness and from all your idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, I will give you a new heart and put a new spirit within you; and I will remove the heart of stone from your flesh and give you a heart of flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will put My Spirit within you and bring it about that you walk in My statutes, and are careful and follow My ordinances.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will live in the land that I gave to your forefathers; so you will be My people, and I will be your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, I will save you from all your uncleanness; and I will call for the grain and multiply it, and I will not bring a famine on you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, I will multiply the fruit of the tree and the produce of the field, so that you will not receive again the disgrace of famine among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will remember your evil ways and your deeds that were not good, and you will loathe yourselves in your own sight for your wrongdoings and your abominations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am not doing this for your sake,” declares the Lord God; “let that be known to you. Be ashamed and humiliated for your ways, house of Israel!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord God says: “On the day that I cleanse you from all your wrongdoings, I will populate the cities, and the places of ruins will be rebuilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The desolated land will be cultivated instead of being a desolation in the sight of everyone who passes by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they will say, ‘This desolated land has become like the Garden of Eden; and the waste, desolated and ruined cities are fortified and inhabited.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the nations around you that are left will know that I, the Lord, have rebuilt the ruined places and planted that which was desolated; I, the Lord, have spoken, and I will do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord God says: “This too I will let the house of Israel ask Me to do for them: I will increase their people like a flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Like the flock for sacrifices, like the flock at Jerusalem during her appointed feasts, so will the waste cities be filled with flocks of people. Then they will know that I am the Lord.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hand of the Lord was upon me, and He brought me out by the Spirit of the Lord and set me down in the middle of the valley; and it was full of bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had me pass among them all around, and behold, there were very many on the surface of the valley; and behold, they were very dry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Son of man, can these bones live?” And I answered, “Lord God, You Yourself know.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again He said to me, “Prophesy over these bones and say to them, ‘You dry bones, hear the word of the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord God says to these bones: ‘Behold, I am going to make breath enter you so that you may come to life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will attach tendons to you, make flesh grow back on you, cover you with skin, and put breath in you so that you may come to life; and you will know that I am the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I prophesied as I was commanded; and as I prophesied, there was a loud noise, and behold, a rattling; and the bones came together, bone to its bone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I looked, and behold, tendons were on them, and flesh grew and skin covered them; but there was no breath in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Prophesy to the breath, prophesy, son of man, and say to the breath, ‘The Lord God says this: “Come from the four winds, breath, and breathe on these slain, so that they come to life.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I prophesied as He commanded me, and the breath entered them, and they came to life and stood on their feet, an exceedingly great army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to me, “Son of man, these bones are the entire house of Israel; behold, they say, ‘Our bones are dried up and our hope has perished. We are completely cut off.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore prophesy and say to them, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “Behold, I am going to open your graves and cause you to come up out of your graves, My people; and I will bring you into the land of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will know that I am the Lord, when I have opened your graves and caused you to come up out of your graves, My people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will put My Spirit within you and you will come to life, and I will place you on your own land. Then you will know that I, the Lord, have spoken and done it,” declares the Lord.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came again to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now you, son of man, take for yourself one stick and write on it, ‘For Judah and for the sons of Israel, his companions’; then take another stick and write on it, ‘For Joseph, the stick of Ephraim and all the house of Israel, his companions.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then put them together for yourself one to another into one stick, so that they may become one in your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the sons of your people speak to you, saying, ‘Will you not declare to us what you mean by these?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: say to them, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “Behold, I am going to take the stick of Joseph, which is in the hand of Ephraim, and the tribes of Israel, his companions; and I will put them with it, with the stick of Judah, and make them one stick, and they will be one in My hand.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sticks on which you write will be in your hand before their eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And say to them, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “Behold, I am going to take the sons of Israel from among the nations where they have gone, and I will gather them from every side and bring them into their own land;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I will make them one nation in the land, on the mountains of Israel; and one king will be king for all of them; and they will no longer be two nations, and no longer be divided into two kingdoms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will no longer defile themselves with their idols, or with their detestable things, or with any of their offenses; but I will rescue them from all their dwelling places in which they have sinned, and will cleanse them. And they will be My people, and I will be their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And My servant David will be king over them, and they will all have one shepherd; and they will walk in My ordinances, and keep My statutes and follow them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they will live on the land that I gave to My servant Jacob, in which your fathers lived; and they will live on it, they, and their sons and their sons’ sons, forever; and My servant David will be their leader forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will make a covenant of peace with them; it will be an everlasting covenant with them. And I will place them and multiply them, and set My sanctuary in their midst forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My dwelling place also will be among them; and I will be their God, and they will be My people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the nations will know that I am the Lord who sanctifies Israel, when My sanctuary is in their midst forever.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, set your face toward Gog of the land of Magog, the chief prince of Meshech and Tubal, and prophesy against him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “Behold, I am against you, Gog, chief prince of Meshech and Tubal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will turn you around and put hooks into your jaws, and I will bring you out, and all your army, horses and horsemen, all of them magnificently dressed, a great contingent with shield and buckler, all of them wielding swords;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Persia, Cush, and Put with them, all of them with buckler and helmet;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gomer with all its troops; Beth-togarmah from the remote parts of the north with all its troops—many peoples with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be ready, and be prepared, you and all your contingents that are assembled around you, and be a guard for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After many days you will be summoned; in the latter years you will come into the land that is restored from the sword, whose inhabitants have been gathered from many nations to the mountains of Israel which had been a continual place of ruins; but its people were brought out from the nations, and they are living securely, all of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will go up, you will come like a storm; you will be like a cloud covering the land, you and all your troops, and many peoples with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord God says: “It will come about on that day, that thoughts will come into your mind and you will devise an evil plan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you will say, ‘I will go up against the land of unwalled villages. I will go against those who are at rest, who live securely, all of them living without walls and having no bars or gates,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to capture spoils and to seize plunder, to turn your hand against the ruins that are now inhabited, and against the people who are gathered from the nations, who have acquired livestock and goods, who live at the center of the world.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sheba and Dedan and the merchants of Tarshish with all its villages will say to you, ‘Have you come to capture spoils? Have you assembled your contingent to seize plunder, to carry away silver and gold, to take away livestock and goods, to capture great spoils?’”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore prophesy, son of man, and say to Gog, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “On that day when My people Israel are living securely, will you not know it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will come from your place out of the remote parts of the north, you and many peoples with you, all of them riding horses, a large assembly and a mighty army;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you will come up against My people Israel like a cloud to cover the land. It shall come about in the last days that I will bring you against My land, so that the nations may know Me when I show Myself holy through you before their eyes, Gog.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord God says: “Are you the one of whom I spoke in former days through My servants the prophets of Israel, who prophesied in those days for many years that I would bring you against them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will come about on that day, when Gog comes against the land of Israel,” declares the Lord God, “that My fury will mount up in My anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In My zeal and in My blazing wrath I declare that on that day there will certainly be a great earthquake in the land of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fish of the sea, the birds of the sky, the animals of the field, all the crawling things that crawl on the earth, and all mankind who are on the face of the earth will shake at My presence; and the mountains will be thrown down, the steep pathways will collapse, and every wall will fall to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will call for a sword against him on all My mountains,” declares the Lord God. “Every man’s sword will be against his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With plague and with blood I will enter into judgment with him; and I will rain on him and on his troops, and on the many peoples who are with him, a torrential rain, hailstones, fire, and brimstone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I will prove Myself great, show Myself holy, and make Myself known in the sight of many nations; and they will know that I am the Lord.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you, son of man, prophesy against Gog and say, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “Behold, I am against you, Gog, chief prince of Meshech and Tubal;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I will turn you around, lead you on a rope, take you up from the remotest parts of the north, and bring you against the mountains of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will strike your bow from your left hand and make your arrows fall from your right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will fall on the mountains of Israel, you and all your troops, and the peoples who are with you; I will give you as food to every kind of predatory bird and animal of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will fall on the open field; for it is I who have spoken,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And I will send fire upon Magog and those who inhabit the coastlands in safety; and they will know that I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And I will make My holy name known in the midst of My people Israel; and I will not allow My holy name to be profaned anymore. But the nations will know that I am the Lord, the Holy One in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, it is coming and it shall be done,” declares the Lord God. “That is the day of which I have spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then those who inhabit the cities of Israel will go out and make fires with the weapons and burn them, both bucklers and shields, bows and arrows, war clubs and spears, and for seven years they will make fires of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will not take wood from the field or gather firewood from the forests, because they will make fires with the weapons; and they will take the spoils of those who plundered them and seize the plunder of those who plundered them,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On that day I will give Gog a burial place there in Israel, the valley of those who pass by east of the sea, and it will block the way of those who would pass by. So they will bury Gog there with all his horde, and they will call it the Valley of Hamon-gog.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For seven months the house of Israel will be burying them in order to cleanse the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people of the land will bury them; and it will be to their renown on the day that I appear in My glory,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They will also select men who will constantly pass through the land, burying those who were passing through, those left on the surface of the ground, in order to cleanse it. At the end of seven months they will conduct a search.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As those who pass through the land pass through and anyone sees a human bone, then he will set up a marker by it until the burial detail has buried it in the Valley of Hamon-gog.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And even the name of the city will be Hamonah. So they will cleanse the land.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now as for you, son of man, this is what the Lord God says: ‘Say to every kind of bird and to every animal of the field: “Assemble and come, gather from every direction to My sacrifice, which I am going to sacrifice for you as a great sacrifice on the mountains of Israel; and you will eat flesh and drink blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will eat the flesh of warriors and drink the blood of the leaders of the earth, as though they were rams, lambs, goats, and bulls, all of them fattened livestock of Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you will eat fat until you are full, and drink blood until you are drunk, from My sacrifice which I have sacrificed for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will eat your fill at My table with horses and charioteers, with warriors and all the men of war,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And I will place My glory among the nations; and all the nations will see My judgment which I have executed, and My hand which I have laid on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the house of Israel will know that I am the Lord their God, from that day onward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The nations will know that the house of Israel went into exile for their wrongdoing, because they were disloyal to Me, and I hid My face from them; so I handed them over to their adversaries, and all of them fell by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In accordance with their uncleanness and their offenses I dealt with them, and I hid My face from them.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore this is what the Lord God says: “Now I will restore the fortunes of Jacob and have mercy on all the house of Israel; and I will be jealous for My holy name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will forget their disgrace and all their treachery which they perpetrated against Me, when they live securely on their own land with no one to make them afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I bring them back from the peoples and gather them from the lands of their enemies, then I shall show Myself holy through them in the sight of the many nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will know that I am the Lord their God because I made them go into exile among the nations, and then I gathered them again to their own land; and I will leave none of them there any longer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will not hide My face from them any longer, for I will have poured out My Spirit on the house of Israel,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the twenty-fifth year of our exile, at the beginning of the year, on the tenth of the month, in the fourteenth year after the city was taken, on this very day the hand of the Lord was upon me and He brought me there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the visions of God He brought me into the land of Israel and set me on a very high mountain, and on it to the south there was something like a structure of a city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So He brought me there; and behold, there was a man whose appearance was like the appearance of bronze, with a thread of flax and a measuring rod in his hand; and he was standing in the gateway.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the man said to me, “Son of man, see with your eyes, hear with your ears, and pay attention to all that I am going to show you; for you have been brought here in order to show it to you. Declare to the house of Israel all that you see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, there was a wall on the outside of the temple all around, and in the man’s hand was a measuring rod of six cubits, each of which was a cubit and a hand width. So he measured the thickness of the wall, one rod; and the height, one rod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went to the gate which faced east, went up its steps, and measured the threshold of the gate, one rod in width; and the other threshold was one rod in width.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The guardroom was one rod long and one rod wide; and there were five cubits between the guardrooms. And the threshold of the gate by the porch of the gate facing inward was one rod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he measured the porch of the gate facing inward, one rod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he measured the porch of the gate, eight cubits; and its side pillars, two cubits. And the porch of the gate was faced inward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The guardrooms of the gate toward the east numbered three on each side; the three of them had the same measurement. The side pillars also had the same measurement on each side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he measured the width of the gateway, ten cubits, and the length of the gate, thirteen cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a barrier wall one cubit wide in front of the guardrooms on each side; and the guardrooms were six cubits square on each side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he measured the gate from the roof of the one guardroom to the roof of the other, a width of twenty-five cubits, from one door to the door opposite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made the side pillars sixty cubits high; the gate extended all around to the side pillar of the courtyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from the front of the entrance gate to the front of the inner porch of the gate was fifty cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were shuttered windows looking toward the guardrooms, and toward their side pillars within the gate all around, and likewise for the porches. And there were windows all around inside; and on each side pillar were palm tree decorations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought me into the outer courtyard, and behold, there were chambers and a stone pavement made for the courtyard all around; thirty chambers faced the pavement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the pavement (that is, the lower pavement) was by the side of the gates, corresponding to the length of the gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he measured the width from the front of the lower gate to the front of the exterior of the inner courtyard, a hundred cubits on the east and on the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And as for the gate of the outer courtyard which faced north, he measured its length and its width.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It had three guardrooms on each side; and its side pillars and its porches had the same measurement as the first gate. Its length was fifty cubits, and the width twenty-five cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its windows, its porches, and its palm tree decorations had the same measurements as the gate which faced east; and it was reached by seven steps, and its porch was in front of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The inner courtyard had a gate opposite the gate on the north as well as the gate on the east; and he measured a hundred cubits from gate to gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he led me toward the south, and behold, there was a gate toward the south; and he measured its side pillars and its porches according to those same measurements.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The gate and its porches had windows all around like those other windows; the length was fifty cubits and the width, twenty-five cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were seven steps going up to it, and its porches were in front of them; and it had palm tree decorations on its side pillars, one on each side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The inner courtyard had a gate toward the south; and he measured from gate to gate toward the south, a hundred cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought me to the inner courtyard by the south gate; and he measured the south gate according to those same measurements.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its guardrooms also, its side pillars, and its porches were according to those same measurements. And the gate and its porches had windows all around; it was fifty cubits long and twenty-five cubits wide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were porches all around, twenty-five cubits long and five cubits wide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And its porches were toward the outer courtyard; and palm tree decorations were on its side pillars, and its stairway had eight steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought me into the inner courtyard toward the east. And he measured the gate according to those same measurements.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its guardrooms also, its side pillars, and its porches were according to those same measurements. And the gate and its porches had windows all around; it was fifty cubits long and twenty-five cubits wide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its porches were toward the outer courtyard; and palm tree decorations were on its side pillars, on each side, and its stairway had eight steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought me to the north gate; and he measured it according to those same measurements,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with its guardrooms, its side pillars, and its porches. And the gate had windows all around; the length was fifty cubits and the width twenty-five cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And its side pillars were toward the outer courtyard; and palm tree decorations were on its side pillars, on each side, and its stairway had eight steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A chamber with its doorway was by the side pillars at the gates; there they rinse the burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in the porch of the gate were two tables on each side, on which to slaughter the burnt offering, the sin offering, and the guilt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the outer side, as one went up to the gateway toward the north, were two tables; and on the other side of the porch of the gate were two tables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Four tables were on each side next to the gate; eight tables on which they slaughter sacrifices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the burnt offering there were four tables of cut stone, a cubit and a half long, a cubit and a half wide, and one cubit high, on which they set the utensils with which they slaughter the burnt offering and the sacrifice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the double hooks, one hand width in length, were installed in the house all around; and on the tables was the flesh of the offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the outside to the inner gate were chambers for the singers in the inner courtyard, one of which was at the side of the north gate, with its front toward the south, and one at the side of the south gate facing north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to me, “This is the chamber which faces south, intended for the priests who are responsible for the temple;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the chamber which faces north is for the priests who are responsible for the altar. They are the sons of Zadok, who from the sons of Levi come near to the Lord to serve Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He measured the courtyard, a perfect square, a hundred cubits long and a hundred cubits wide; and the altar was in front of the temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought me to the porch of the temple and measured each side pillar of the porch, five cubits on each side; and the width of the gate was three cubits on each side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of the porch was twenty cubits, and the width eleven cubits; and at the stairway by which it was ascended were columns belonging to the side pillars, one on each side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought me to the sanctuary, and he measured the side pillars: six cubits wide on each side was the width of the side pillar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The width of the entrance was ten cubits and the sides of the entrance were five cubits on each side. He also measured the length of the sanctuary, forty cubits, and the width, twenty cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went inside and measured each side pillar of the doorway, two cubits, and the doorway, six cubits high; and the width of the doorway, seven cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he measured its length, twenty cubits, and the width, twenty cubits, before the sanctuary; and he said to me, “This is the Most Holy Place.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he measured the wall of the temple, six cubits; and the width of the side chambers, four cubits, all around the house on every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The side chambers were in three stories, one above another, and thirty in each story; and the side chambers extended to the wall which stood on their inward side all around, so that they could be attached, but not be attached to the wall of the temple itself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the side chambers surrounding the temple were wider at each successive story. Because the structure surrounding the temple went upward by stages on all sides of the temple, for that reason the width of the temple increased as it went higher; and so one went up from the lowest story to the highest by way of the second story.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw also that the house had a raised platform all around; the foundations of the side chambers were a full rod of six long cubits in height.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thickness of the outer wall of the side chambers was five cubits. But the free space between the side chambers belonging to the temple
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the outer chambers was twenty cubits in width around the temple on every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The doorways of the side chambers toward the free space consisted of one doorway toward the north, and another doorway toward the south; and the width of the free space was five cubits all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The building that was in front of the separate area at the side toward the west was seventy cubits wide; and the wall of the building was five cubits thick all around, and its length was ninety cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he measured the temple, a hundred cubits long; the separate area with the building and its walls were also a hundred cubits long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also the width of the front of the temple and that of the separate areas along the east side totaled a hundred cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he measured the length of the building along the front of the separate area behind it, with a gallery on each side, a hundred cubits; he also measured the inner sanctuary and the porches of the courtyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thresholds, the latticed windows, and the galleries all around their three stories, opposite the threshold, were paneled with wood all around, and from the ground to the windows (but the windows were covered),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: over the entrance, and to the inner house, and on the outside, and on all the wall all around inside and outside, by measurement.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was carved with cherubim and palm trees; and a palm tree was between cherub and cherub, and every cherub had two faces:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a human face toward the palm tree on one side and a young lion’s face toward the palm tree on the other side; they were carved on all the house all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the ground to above the entrance cherubim and palm trees were carved, as well as on the wall of the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The doorposts of the sanctuary were square; as for the front of the inner sanctuary, the appearance of one doorpost was like that of the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The altar was of wood, three cubits high, and its length two cubits; its corners, its base, and its sides were of wood. And he said to me, “This is the table that is before the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sanctuary and the inner sanctuary each had a double door.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of the doors had two leaves, two swinging leaves; two leaves for one door and two leaves for the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also there were carved on them, on the doors of the main room, cherubim and palm trees like those carved on the walls; and there was a threshold of wood on the front of the porch outside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were latticed windows and palm trees on one side and on the other, on the sides of the porch; the same were on the side chambers of the house and the thresholds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought me out into the outer courtyard, the way toward the north; and he brought me to the chamber which was opposite the separate area and opposite the building toward the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Along the length, which was a hundred cubits, was the north door; the width was fifty cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Opposite the twenty cubits which belonged to the inner courtyard, and opposite the stone pavement which belonged to the outer courtyard, was gallery corresponding to gallery in three stories.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In front of the chambers was an inner passage ten cubits wide, a way of one hundred cubits; and their openings were on the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the upper chambers were smaller because the galleries took more space away from them than from the lower and middle ones in the building.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they were in three stories and had no pillars like the pillars of the courtyards; for that reason the upper chambers were set back from the ground upward, more than the lower and middle ones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the outer wall by the side of the chambers, toward the outer courtyard facing the chambers, its length was fifty cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the length of the chambers which were in the outer courtyard was fifty cubits; and behold, the length of those facing the main room was a hundred cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And below these chambers was the entrance on the east side, as one enters them from the outer courtyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the thickness of the wall of the courtyard toward the east, facing the separate area and facing the building, there were chambers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the way in front of them was like the appearance of the chambers which were on the north; according to their length, so was their width, and all their exits were according to their building plans and openings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Corresponding to the openings of the chambers which were toward the south was an opening at the head of the way, the way in front of the wall toward the east, as one enters them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to me, “The north chambers and the south chambers, which are opposite the separate area, they are the holy chambers where the priests who are near to the Lord shall eat the most holy things. There they shall set the most holy things, the grain offering, the sin offering, and the guilt offering; for the place is holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the priests enter, they shall not go out into the outer courtyard from the sanctuary without laying their garments there in which they minister, for they are holy. They shall put on other garments; then they shall approach that which is for the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when he had finished measuring the inner house, he brought me out by way of the gate which faced east, and measured it all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He measured on the east side with the measuring rod: five hundred rods by the measuring rod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He measured on the north side: five hundred rods by the measuring rod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the south side he measured five hundred rods with the measuring rod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He turned to the west side and measured five hundred rods with the measuring rod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He measured it on the four sides; it had a wall all around, the length five hundred rods and the width five hundred, to divide between the holy and the common.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he led me to the gate, the gate facing east;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and behold, the glory of the God of Israel was coming from the way of the east. And His voice was like the sound of many waters; and the earth shone from His glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was like the appearance of the vision which I saw, like the vision which I saw when He came to destroy the city. And the visions were like the vision which I saw by the river Chebar; and I fell on my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the glory of the Lord entered the house by way of the gate facing east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Spirit lifted me up and brought me into the inner courtyard; and behold, the glory of the Lord filled the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I heard Him speaking to me from the house, while a man was standing beside me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to me, “Son of man, this is the place of My throne and the place of the soles of My feet, where I will dwell among the sons of Israel forever. And the house of Israel will not again defile My holy name, neither they nor their kings, by their prostitution and by the corpses of their kings when they die,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: by putting their threshold by My threshold, and their door post beside My door post, with only the wall between Me and them. And they have defiled My holy name by their abominations which they have committed. So I have consumed them in My anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now let them remove their prostitution and the corpses of their kings far from Me, and I will dwell among them forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for you, son of man, inform the house of Israel of the temple, so that they will be ashamed of their wrongdoings; and have them measure the plan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if they are ashamed of everything that they have done, make known to them the plan of the house, its layout, its exits, its entrances, all its plans, all its statutes, and all its laws. And write it in their sight, so that they may observe its entire plan and all its statutes and execute them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the law of the house: its entire area on the top of the mountain all around shall be most holy. Behold, this is the law of the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And these are the measurements of the altar by cubits (the cubit being a cubit and a hand width): the base shall be a cubit and the width a cubit, and its border on its edge all around one span; and this shall be the height of the base of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from the base on the ground to the lower ledge shall be two cubits, and the width one cubit; and from the smaller ledge to the larger ledge shall be four cubits, and the width one cubit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The altar hearth shall be four cubits; and from the altar hearth shall extend upward four horns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the altar hearth shall be twelve cubits long by twelve wide, square in its four sides.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the ledge shall be fourteen cubits long by fourteen wide in its four sides, the border around it shall be half a cubit, and its base shall be a cubit all around; and its steps shall face east.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And He said to me, “Son of man, this is what the Lord God says: ‘These are the statutes for the altar on the day it is built, to offer burnt offerings on it and to sprinkle blood on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall give to the Levitical priests who are from the descendants of Zadok, who come near to Me to serve Me,’ declares the Lord God, ‘a bull as a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall take some of its blood and put it on its four horns and on the four corners of the ledge, and on the border all around; so you shall cleanse it and make atonement for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall also take the bull as the sin offering, and it shall be burned in the appointed place of the house, outside the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘And on the second day you shall offer a male goat without blemish as a sin offering, and they shall cleanse the altar from sin as they cleansed it with the bull.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you have finished cleansing it, you shall offer a bull without blemish and a ram without blemish from the flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall offer them before the Lord, and the priests shall throw salt on them, and they shall offer them up as a burnt offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For seven days you shall prepare a goat as a sin offering daily; also a bull and a ram from the flock, both without blemish, shall be prepared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For seven days they shall make atonement for the altar and purify it; so shall they consecrate it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they have completed the days, it shall be that on the eighth day and onward, the priests shall offer your burnt offerings on the altar, and your peace offerings; and I will accept you,’ declares the Lord God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He brought me back by way of the outer gate of the sanctuary, which faces east; and it was shut.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to me, “This gate shall be shut; it shall not be opened, and no one shall enter by it, for the Lord God of Israel has entered by it; therefore it shall be shut.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for the prince, he shall sit in it as prince to eat bread before the Lord; he shall enter by way of the porch of the gate and shall go out by the same way.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He brought me by way of the north gate to the front of the house; and I looked, and behold, the glory of the Lord filled the house of the Lord, and I fell on my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord said to me, “Son of man, pay attention, see with your eyes and hear with your ears everything that I say to you concerning all the statutes of the house of the Lord and all its laws; and pay attention to the entrance of the house, with all the exits of the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall say to the rebellious ones, to the house of Israel, ‘This is what the Lord God says: “Enough of all your abominations, house of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when you brought in foreigners, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, to be in My sanctuary to profane it, My house, when you offered My food, the fat, and the blood and they broke My covenant—this in addition to all your abominations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you have not taken responsibility for My holy things yourselves, but you have appointed foreigners to take responsibility for My sanctuary.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord God says: “No foreigner uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, of all the foreigners who are among the sons of Israel, shall enter My sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Levites who went far from Me when Israel went astray, who went astray from Me following their idols, shall suffer the punishment for their wrongdoing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet they shall be ministers in My sanctuary, having oversight at the gates of the house and ministering in the house; they shall slaughter the burnt offering and the sacrifice for the people, and they shall stand before them to minister to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since they ministered to them before their idols and became a stumbling block of wrongdoing to the house of Israel, for that reason I have sworn against them,” declares the Lord God, “that they shall suffer the punishment for their wrongdoing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall not approach Me to serve as priests for Me, nor approach any of My holy things, to the things that are most holy; but they will bear their shame and their abominations which they have committed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless I will appoint them to take responsibility for the house, of all its service and of everything that shall be done in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But the Levitical priests, the sons of Zadok, who took responsibility for My sanctuary when the sons of Israel went astray from Me, shall come near to Me to serve Me; and they shall stand before Me to offer Me the fat and the blood,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They shall enter My sanctuary; they shall come near to My table to serve Me and assume the responsibility I give them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be that when they enter at the gates of the inner courtyard, they shall be clothed with linen garments; and wool shall not be worn by them while they are ministering in the gates of the inner courtyard or in the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Linen turbans shall be on their heads and linen undergarments shall be around their waists; they shall not put on anything that makes them sweat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they go out into the outer courtyard, into the outer courtyard to the people, they shall take off their garments in which they have been ministering and lay them in the holy chambers; then they shall put on other garments, so that they will not transfer holiness to the people with their garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also they shall not shave their heads, yet they shall not let their locks grow long; they shall only trim the hair of their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nor shall any of the priests drink wine when they enter the inner courtyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall not marry a widow or a divorced woman, but shall take virgins from the descendants of the house of Israel, or a widow who is the widow of a priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, they shall teach My people the difference between the holy and the common, and teach them to distinguish between the unclean and the clean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In a dispute they shall take their stand to judge; they shall judge it according to My ordinances. They shall also keep My laws and My statutes in all My appointed feasts, and sanctify My Sabbaths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall not go to a dead person to defile themselves; however, for father, for mother, for son, for daughter, for brother, or for a sister who has not had a husband, they may defile themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he is cleansed, seven days shall elapse for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the day that he goes into the sanctuary, to the inner courtyard to minister in the sanctuary, he shall offer his sin offering,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And it shall be regarding an inheritance for them, that I am their inheritance; and you shall give them no property in Israel—I am their property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall eat the grain offering, the sin offering, and the guilt offering; and everything banned from secular use in Israel shall be theirs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the first of all the first fruits of every kind and every contribution of every kind, from all your contributions, shall be for the priests; you shall also give to the priest the first of your dough, to make a blessing rest on your house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests shall not eat any bird or animal that has died a natural death or has been torn to pieces by animals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now when you divide the land by lot for inheritance, you shall offer an allotment to the Lord, a holy portion of the land; the length shall be a length of twenty-five thousand cubits, and the width shall be twenty thousand. It shall be holy within its entire surrounding boundary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of this there shall be for the sanctuary a square encompassing five hundred by five hundred cubits, and fifty cubits for its open space round about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From this area you shall measure a length of twenty-five thousand cubits and a width of ten thousand cubits; and in it shall be the sanctuary, the Most Holy Place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be the holy portion of the land; it shall be for the priests, the ministers of the sanctuary, who come near to serve the Lord, and it shall be a place for their houses and a holy place for the sanctuary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: An area twenty-five thousand cubits in length and ten thousand in width shall be for the Levites, the ministers of the house, and for their possession cities in which to live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you shall give the city possession of an area five thousand cubits wide and twenty-five thousand cubits long, alongside the allotment of the holy portion; it shall be for the entire house of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And the prince shall have land on either side of the holy allotment and the property of the city, adjacent to the holy allotment and the property of the city, on the west side toward the west and on the east side toward the east, and in length comparable to one of the portions, from the west border to the east border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This shall be his land as a possession in Israel; so My princes shall no longer oppress My people, but they shall give the rest of the land to the house of Israel according to their tribes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord God says: “Enough, you princes of Israel; get rid of violence and destruction, and practice justice and righteousness. Revoke your evictions of My people,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall have accurate balances, an accurate ephah, and an accurate bath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ephah and the bath shall be the same quantity, so that the bath will contain a tenth of a homer, and the ephah a tenth of a homer; their standard shall be according to the homer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the shekel shall be twenty gerahs; twenty shekels, twenty-five shekels, and fifteen shekels shall be your mina.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “This is the offering that you shall offer: a sixth of an ephah from each homer of wheat; a sixth of an ephah from each homer of barley;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the prescribed portion of oil (namely, the bath of oil), a tenth of a bath from each kor (which is ten baths or a homer, for ten baths are a homer);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one sheep from each flock of two hundred from the watering places of Israel—for a grain offering, for a burnt offering, and for peace offerings, to make atonement for them,” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “All the people of the land shall give to this offering for the prince in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall be the prince’s part to provide the burnt offerings, the grain offerings, and the drink offerings, at the feasts, on the new moons, and on the Sabbaths, at all the appointed feasts of the house of Israel; he shall provide the sin offering, the grain offering, the burnt offering, and the peace offerings, to make atonement for the house of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord God says: “In the first month, on the first of the month, you shall take a bull without blemish and cleanse the sanctuary from sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the priest shall take some of the blood from the sin offering and put it on the door posts of the house, on the four corners of the ledge of the altar, and on the posts of the gate of the inner courtyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall do this on the seventh day of the month for everyone who does wrong inadvertently or is naive; so you shall make atonement for the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, you shall have the Passover, a feast of seven days; unleavened bread shall be eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day the prince shall provide for himself and all the people of the land a bull as a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And during the seven days of the feast he shall provide as a burnt offering to the Lord seven bulls and seven rams without blemish on every day of the seven days, and a male goat daily as a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall provide as a grain offering an ephah with a bull, an ephah with a ram, and a hin of oil with an ephah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the seventh month, on the fifteenth day of the month, at the feast, he shall provide like these, seven days for the sin offering, the burnt offering, the grain offering, and the oil.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord God says: “The gate of the inner courtyard facing east shall be shut for the six working days; but it shall be opened on the Sabbath day and opened on the day of the new moon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The prince shall enter by way of the porch of the gate from outside and stand by the post of the gate. Then the priests shall provide his burnt offering and his peace offerings, and he shall worship at the threshold of the gate and then go out; but the gate shall not be shut until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of the land shall also worship at the doorway of that gate before the Lord on the Sabbaths and on the new moons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The burnt offering which the prince shall offer to the Lord on the Sabbath day shall be six lambs without blemish and a ram without blemish;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the grain offering shall be an ephah with the ram, and the grain offering with the lambs as much as he is able to give, and a hin of oil with an ephah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the day of the new moon he shall offer a bull without blemish, and six lambs and a ram, which shall be without blemish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he shall provide a grain offering, an ephah with the bull and an ephah with the ram, and with the lambs as much as he is able, and a hin of oil with an ephah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the prince enters, he shall go in by way of the porch of the gate, and go out by the same way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the people of the land come before the Lord at the appointed feasts, one who enters by way of the north gate to worship shall go out by way of the south gate. And one who enters by way of the south gate shall go out by way of the north gate. No one shall return by way of the gate by which he entered, but shall go straight out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they go in, the prince shall go in among them; and when they go out, he shall go out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “At the festivals and the appointed feasts, the grain offering shall be an ephah with a bull and an ephah with a ram, and with the lambs as much as one is able to give, and a hin of oil with an ephah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the prince provides a voluntary offering, a burnt offering, or peace offerings as a voluntary offering to the Lord, the gate facing east shall be opened for him. And he shall provide his burnt offering and his peace offerings as he does on the Sabbath day. Then he shall go out, and the gate shall be shut after he goes out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you shall provide a lamb a year old without blemish as a burnt offering to the Lord daily; morning by morning you shall provide it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall also provide a grain offering with it morning by morning, a sixth of an ephah and a third of a hin of oil to moisten the fine flour, a grain offering to the Lord continually by a permanent ordinance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they shall provide the lamb, the grain offering, and the oil, morning by morning, as a continual burnt offering.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘This is what the Lord God says: “If the prince gives a gift from his inheritance to any of his sons, it shall belong to his sons; it is their possession by inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he gives a gift from his inheritance to one of his servants, it shall be his until the year of release; then it shall return to the prince. His inheritance shall be only his sons’; it shall belong to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the prince shall not take from the people’s inheritance, depriving them of their property; he shall give his sons inheritance from his own property, so that My people will not be scattered, anyone from his property.”’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought me through the entrance, which was at the side of the gate, into the holy chambers for the priests, which faced north; and behold, a place was there at the extreme rear toward the west.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to me, “This is the place where the priests shall boil the guilt offering and the sin offering, and where they shall bake the grain offering, so that they do not bring them out into the outer courtyard and transfer holiness to the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought me out into the outer courtyard and led me across to the four corners of the courtyard; and behold, in every corner of the courtyard there was a small courtyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the four corners of the courtyard there were enclosed courtyards, forty cubits long and thirty wide; these four in the corners were the same size.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there was a row of masonry all around in them, around the four of them, and cooking hearths were made under the rows all around.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to me, “These are the cooking places where the ministers of the house shall cook the sacrifices of the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he brought me back to the door of the house; and behold, water was flowing from under the threshold of the house toward the east, for the house faced east. And the water was flowing down from under, from the right side of the house, from south of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he brought me out by way of the north gate and led me around on the outside to the outer gate, by the way facing east. And behold, water was spurting out from the south side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the man went out toward the east with a line in his hand, he measured a thousand cubits, and he led me through the water, water reaching the ankles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he measured a thousand and led me through the water, water reaching the knees. Again he measured a thousand and led me through the water, water reaching the hips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he measured a thousand; and it was a river that I could not wade across, because the water had risen, enough water to swim in, a river that could not be crossed by wading.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to me, “Son of man, have you seen this?” Then he brought me back to the bank of the river.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when I had returned, behold, on the bank of the river there were very many trees on the one side and on the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to me, “These waters go out toward the eastern region and go down into the Arabah; then they go toward the sea, being made to flow into the sea, and the waters of the sea become fresh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it will come about that every living creature which swarms in every place where the river goes, will live. And there will be very many fish, for these waters go there and the others become fresh; so everything will live where the river goes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it will come about that fishermen will stand beside it; from Engedi to Eneglaim there will be a place for the spreading of nets. Their fish will be according to their kinds, like the fish of the Great Sea, very many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But its swamps and marshes will not become fresh; they will be left for salt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And by the river on its bank, on one side and on the other, will grow all kinds of trees for food. Their leaves will not wither and their fruit will not fail. They will bear fruit every month because their water flows from the sanctuary, and their fruit will be for food and their leaves for healing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what the Lord God says: “This shall be the boundary by which you shall divide the land for an inheritance among the twelve tribes of Israel; Joseph shall have two portions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall divide it for an inheritance, each one equally with the other; for I swore to give it to your forefathers, and this land shall fall to you as an inheritance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And this shall be the boundary of the land: on the north side, from the Great Sea by the way of Hethlon, to the entrance of Zedad;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hamath, Berothah, Sibraim, which is between the border of Damascus and the border of Hamath; Hazer-hatticon, which is by the border of Hauran.
verses.speaker: Narrator
